Reviews.Title: “Nice place in best part of town”
Reviews.Author: LUTiger16
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is a nice place that is located in the most pertinent place of Chicago.The hotel is very classic and gives you that warm feel . The staff are phenomenal. I got the best recommendation for a steak. You can't beat the value for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Jan W
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Chicago, make sure to check out this hotel. It is located a block from the Magnificent Mile - right across the street from the Water Tower Mall. The hotel is definitely old but that is what gives it its character. The hotel staff was friendly, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the shower was hot. We had a great view out the front of the the hotel on the 11th floor. We were able to go out and see the sites and then come back in the afternoon for a rest before heading out in the evening once again. This hotel is close to everything and a great bargain for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but has lost some luster”
Reviews.Author: M2hra
Reviews.Content: The Tremont was my hotel of choice in Chicago for years. Stayed a night recently for first time in 5 years. Positives - great location on a quiet street just off Michigan Ave. Now a Starwood Property so I get points. Starbucks across the street, 2 blocks from Water Tower Place. Old world charm with a small, boutique feel. Negatives - appeared a bit run-down. Wood paneling is scratched and faded, beds are not the typical Starwood Perfect Sleeper. Bathrooms are cramped and outdated. The single elevator for all 16 floors is slow and rickety. No real lobby. It is in need of some renovation and updating - more furniture in the day room with refreshments would help. Worth it if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic”
Reviews.Author: JimEveryCountry
Reviews.Content: I get the opportunity to stay in a classic hotel from time to time... not shiny chrome and black marble floors, but rich wood, ornate decor and a tiny elevator. The rooms are smaller, but the room we were in seemed upgraded (marble floor, counter in bathroom). As you enter the hotel, the great room (to the left) is a great room to sit in while waiting. I agree with the previous writer (about the $5 breakfast). there's a Starbucks across the street and at least a half dozen restaurants within 2 blocks that serve great food. The staff were great and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the making”
Reviews.Author: FitzDD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel when many other hotels in the area were full and placed a last minute bid on Priceline. The rate was very reasonable based on what I was finding at other hotels. Pluses - Character, location, wonderful staff, cozy lobby, very comfortable bed. Minuses - Thin walls, shower that wouldn't drain, no view, no clock in the room and few electrical outlets. Regarding the elevator - request a room on a lower floor. We only ran into an elevator wait once and just hoofed it up to the third floor. In doing so we also got a view of the Ditka's kitchen and met some of their friendly staff! But all in all the pluses outweighed the minuses. Can't wait to see the place after Starwood spruces it up.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm; Mag mile convenience!”
Reviews.Author: Earlmuck
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is old. It creaks and the elevator rumbles a bit. But it was clean, the staff attentive and pleasant, the location out of this world, and it had character you just don't find in sterile chain hotels. I read some of the other review and was a bit concerned-- especially about the elevator wait times. Well, we were on The15th floor and never had to wait more than a minute or two for the elevator. This is the best value around and oh-so-conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, OK room”
Reviews.Author: mcsquirrel
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this place - the hotel itself majorly needs updating, but it is priced accordingly and the location is amazing. If you are on a tight budget in Chicago, the Tremont may be a good option for you. The location, just off Magnificent Mile, is excellent. We stayed here in August, at a time when other rooms in the area were at least 3 x's the price per night. It was awesome getting up in the morning, walking one way to Michigan Ave, walking the other way to the Red Line. As far as the hotel itself, well.... It was very dark, and had a stale feeling to it. I didn't care for our room: it was outdated and the carpet always felt slightly semi-damp to me, although my husband said it didn't really feel that way to him. I did not feel comfortable walking around the room in my bare feet. Although the room seemed kind of musty to me, it was quiet (except for an occasional vent/AC sound?), and the bed and bathroom were clean. I think if the hotel were to update the rooms, even with just new paint and carpet, it would make a world of difference. As the hotel is in the perfect location, and the rate reflected the room quality, I gave it a "Very Good" rating. Since we were in Chicago for a quick trip on a tight budget, and we didn't spend much time in our room, the Tremont was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dsm1k
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the poor reviews that have been posted, I was very pleased with my first stay this past week. Got a nice room on the 15th floor. Staff was very helpful For the value, this is the best Starwood Property in Chicago! The property reminds of many fine boutique hotels I have encountered travelling through Europe. I will be back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “For the $ Best a value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: SchmengeToo
Reviews.Content: For those with a limited budget this is THE best value for lodging in Downtown Chicago, when you can book in the $80/nite range. We've have stayed in some dives and we have stayed in some 5 Star places like Shutters on the Beach in Santa Monica, The San Maria Isabel in Mexico City, Penninsulas, etc. The Tremont is a 5 Star dive. It is a little rough on the edges but for the value and location it can't be beat. The lobby has a very nice sitting area with nice leather chairs and couches. Right next door is Ditka's which has a decent menu (on the spendy side though). We stayed in room 1503 which was small but adequate. As we were out and about the town most the time, the room size mattered little. The windows were small but the room got good light in the day and has a nice view of Michigan Avenue. Cable channels were limited but the carried FOX (Rare for Chicago) a plus for us NRA members. Room could have used a place to hang up stuff but overall a really suitable place. We've rated service average because we had really no interaction with the staff, though the limited interaction we did have was very nice. For the value and location and condition of rooms our room at least was thumbs-up.

Reviews.Title: “Location, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: buckiz1980
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago, but I needed two stays to get to platinum status at Starwood and this was the cheapest one in the city. We planned on going shopping, leaving our bags, having dinner at Ditka's and staying the night. After checking in, we went up to the room and decided that we would go shopping, leave our bags, have dinner, and go back home. The positives - location and price. The hotel is located right off of Michigan Ave and is ideal if you want to come to town to go shopping. We paid $100 including tax, which is great in downtown Chicago - especially with this location. The hallways and rooms need considerable renovation. The wallpaper, light fixtures and carpet look like they are 20 years old. The hotel wasn't dirty, it was just really, really old. One thing I noticed was that there was very little Starwood branding in the hotel. I am wagering this was intentional. If cost and location are your key motivators for selecting a hotel, then you could go with this one. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: cdavies757
Reviews.Content: It has been seven years since I had last stayed at The Tremont and there were no visible signs of any investment in maintaining or improving facilities. The location however is fantastic and great value for money. I am not sure how the hotel fits in with the Starwood Group but the hotel has everything you need for a shopping trip in a downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: LARRYANDSALLY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tremont during our yearly Christmas trip to Chicago - not sure we will stay there again. Each year this hotel gets a little more run down. If we didn't get such a good deal on an internet website -we for sure would not stay here. I can do without the coffee in our room and no vending machine AT ALL! But...the room had some issues - black moldy looking stain around the sink and the ceiling looked like there had been a leak. Our room was so hot we had to open the window to let in cold air - even with the heat turned completely off! This hotel is very quaint and with some work could be a great place to stay - one block off of Michigan Ave - perfect location for shopping and if you leave your gifts at the front desk they will wrap them for you!!! An unusual perk!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Tired”
Reviews.Author: dan c
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is in a very good location, just off of Michigan Ave and literally attached to Mike Ditka's steakhouse. Those are the two pluses. The cons - it's a tired hotel. I paid $280'ish a night for it. It was a last minute business trip and the price was actually considerably lower than the other premium hotels in the area, so I booked it. I was pleasantly surprised to learn it was a Starwood property when I checked in. I guess that was a plus too if you're a Starwood person. Check-in was fine, polite and helpful desk attendant. To go up to the room, I had to get into the hotel's LONE elevator. It's a 16-story hotel and they have one elevator. Waiting on the elevator never took less than a couple of minutes, which was highly annoying. Also - no gym. My option was to walk down the street to the Westin to work out which I did. But there is no locker room facilities there, so you have to think through that process - Chicago in November/December is cold. I wore regular clothes over to the hotel with my overcoat and changed in a bathroom. I did the same after the workout. Not exactly convenient. The room was just old & tired - that's about all I can say about it. But it was clean and adequate. I would only stay there again if in a pinch. Sorry Tremont.

Reviews.Title: “Could be quite nice with a spruce up”
Reviews.Author: JEL-CT
Reviews.Content: Clearly showing its wear. Could be quite nice with a bit of tlc. Older hotel in good location. Front desk a bit seedy. Addition of a fitness center would be a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Tremont weekend”
Reviews.Author: PenciaT
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is in a very old building & you could really tell. The hotel really smelled likes grandmas. Staff was OK but in the morning you could not even get coffee after 9:30 on Sunday morning & no coffee was supplied in the room. They put is in the studios appartments right next door so I am not sure if the regular rooms had them. SOrry to sound nit picky but I need coffee 1st thing to function so this kinda pissed me off. Starbucks is across the street but I was not dressed to really go outside in the cold

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you are anosmic, hard of hearing, and don't mind taking stairs”
Reviews.Author: Kiev_October
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. The Tremont Hotel is a few blocks from the lakefront, right next to Mike Ditkaâ€™s restaurant, and literally a few steps from the Miracle Mile. Just around the corner, is the old water tower. You could not ask for a better location in Downtown Chicago, especially if you are planning to buy a Rolls Royceâ€¦I think the dealership is right around the corner from them. Good things: â€¢ The hotel is reasonably priced for Downtown Chicago. â€¢ The reservation system was quite efficient, and unlike many other Downtown Chicago hotels, we got what we asked for â€“ nonsmoking, clean, that faced away from the street. The room itself was of average size for a Downtown Chicago hotel, reasonably clean, and had a bathroom with hot water than came on immediately and stayed through a nice long soaking shower. â€¢ The best thing about the hotel â€“ the bed. An excellent, firm mattress, lots of extra pillows, and extra blankets. â€¢ A very friendly place! We did really did get to know the folks in the room next door to us quite well. They had read a half of what Ben Franklin had to say. You know, that line about early to bed and early to rise. They read the early to rise part, but not the early to bed. We know they were early to rise, because at 7:30 in the morning, Chicago time (remember, thatâ€™s 5:30 in the morning California time on Sunday), we could hear the television from their room better than we could hear the television when we turned it on in our room. We also know that they werenâ€™t early to bed. In fact, beddy-bye time for them was about 0300, but they got back from whatever bar they were visiting at about 0200. At least they didnâ€™t turn on the TV; they didnâ€™t need it, because the three or four of them were having such a good time with their drunken rambling and high-pitched cackling laugh, that they might not have noticed the television anyway. We enjoyed their company almost as much as we enjoyed breakfast the next morning. â€¢ The Negatives: â€¢ The staff (!). Ask them whether there is a health club in the hotel, and they do not think so, but arenâ€™t sure. Ask them whether the hotel provides vouchers for a nearby health club, and they do not think so, but arenâ€™t sure. Ask them whether there is a health club nearby the hotel, and they do not think so, but arenâ€™t sure. At least they were not negative about anything, but we ultimately concluded that they do not think too much. And I do not think much of them. And I am sure. â€¢ Climate control in the room did not work at all. We visited this hotel during October. The temperature outside was in the low 60s during the day and down into the 50s at night. The temperature in the room was very little different. We asked the staff if they could get it to work, and we got the reply that weâ€™d gotten used to: they do not think so, but arenâ€™t sure. â€¢ Breakfast. They called it a continental breakfast for $5. Tepid coffee, orange juice from concentrate, rolls that I think came out of a Sara Lee package, one over-ripe banana as the fruit choice, and no yogurt, milk, or even the hotel-grade scramble egg that you expect at Holiday Inn Express. I do not mind paying $10 or $15 for continental breakfast in a downtown hotel. For this breakfast, $5 was absurd. â€¢ The elevators. Actually, scratch that. Not plural. The elevator. There is only one elevator to serve the hotel, and it seems to have a drinking problem. That is, the elevator works only when it wants to, and then only quite slowly. Come to think of it, it reminds me of a lot of state employees. Maybe it is a state employee. So I used the stairs instead. â€¢ Most memorable part of the hotel â€“ it stinks! No, not figuratively. Literally. It stinks. After waiting almost ten minutes for the elevator, I decided to take the stairs (our room was only five floors up). Go up one flight, and you will notice a bit of an odor. As you go up the second flight, the odor becomesâ€¦distinctive. I am not certain of exactly what the smell was, and I really do not want to know. I would just advise that you do what I didâ€¦wait for the elevator next time, even if it takes 15 minutes (which it did).

Reviews.Title: “A shopper's dream location!”
Reviews.Author: ironista
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Tremont is its location just around the corner from Water Tower Place, H & M, American Girl and all that the Magnificent Mile has to offer. Transportation is a snap, with buses running down Michigan Ave. 24/7, the Red Line within walking distance, and a friendly doorman ready to hail a cab (which were always plentiful). The rooms are on the small and dowdy side, but clean. Our room was cleaned every day by noon, and the bathroom was spotless. So many reviewers complained about the slow elevators that I turned my iPhone stopwatch on every time I hit the elevator call button, just to see how slow they were. In five days I almost never spent more than a minute either from my floor (15th) to the lobby or vice versa. Only one trip was even marginally slow; 4 minutes from leaving my room to arriving in the lobby, and that was on Sunday when a lot of people were checking out of the completely-full hotel. So, I don't know why people complain about the slow elevator; wait time was no longer than at most hotels of newer vintage. We didn't eat at Ditka's (too many "must-visit" restaurants on our list) but it smelled delicious, and I did peek in there when I saw an SUV parked outside with EX BEAR 1 license plates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Value for price”
Reviews.Author: kstraveler62
Reviews.Content: Was in Chicago for a quick mini-reunion of law school friends. Plan was to stay "Big Chill" style at someone's house-but had work to do and wanted some "down time" so was pleased when my SPG preferred status told me of $129 rate. . . which I booked before I read any reviews online. Yes, the building is old and it does look like wallpaper, etc could be refreshed (would be interested in knowing if Starwood has plans to do so). . . but room was clean--I love the location--and the bed was comfy and what I expect from Starwood properties. Would be great if some updates were made (including maybe somewhere other than a bar to buy a bottle of war at 10:30 at night when it is cold and I don't want to walk 3 blocks to a White Hen. Front desk staff was pleasant and I would stay here again for the price I received--maybe not for the "standard" price. Hope Starwood does some upgrades as this has lots of potential!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff In An Older Building”
Reviews.Author: SURF4FUN007
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Chicago is located just off of Chicago's Miracle Mile -- it's a fantastic location for all of your North Michigan Avenue shopping, eating and exploring. That said, it is an older building and therefore there is only so much upgrading that they can do. Also, there is only one passenger elevator for the entire hotel. This is a SPG (Starwood) hotel, however, you will not find the usual SPG guest or preferred guest amenities here (no Starbucks coffee makers in the rooms, etc.). The rooms are okay and clean. The beds are comfortable and both of our rooms had a flat screen TV, work desk, chair and midsized bathroom. The thermostat can only put out heat in the winter months and AC in the summer months -- if you visit during the transitional months you may be a bit uncomfortable. Ditka's (a Chicago sports legend) restaurant is connected with the hotel and for $5 you'll get a continental breakfast coupon to use at Ditka's. The breakfast was pretty sparse, self serve and we only saw a wait person once during our week stay. For a few dollars more, you can walk across the street and have oatmeal and coffee at Starbucks. So, if you're all about location, this is the place for you -- if you're all about hotel luxury, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good deal”
Reviews.Author: tas2711
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel through expedia unpublished rate .. Was very sceptical at first after reading some negative reviews.. But was very happy once I saw the hotel. It was at a great location, feel of great old charming hotel with nice clean cozy room. Nothing could beat the deal, if u r paying a very high price and expect an upbeat classy hotel, then this might not be your best choice. I like the old woody effect. Hence I wud definitely give this a thumbs up...

Reviews.Title: “A little run down . . but classy in its own way . . .”
Reviews.Author: Austinbe1
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is old and needs to be updated and better maintained. But the location is great and the price was right for a long weekend in the windy city. Also being in the hotel with Ditka's as the restaursant was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very worn out hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MikeTC
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs an extreme makeover. It was incredibly disappointing. The location has a great deal of potential.

Reviews.Title: “Business Conference”
Reviews.Author: Palo905
Reviews.Content: Stay there Nice hotel, a little old with new ammedities. Great location. it was within minutes of some great chicago sites and within a few blocks of the trains to get you anywhere you wanted. Only complaints w were 1. no vending machines so that required a little coordination to get drinks, 2. Windows were not very sound proof - Heard the noise of the street on the 9th floor. Hotel is older but has character and charm. If you want a little history wiht your stay, this is the place to be. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They arranged 4 taxi vans for our group and their only questions was what time and how many. They were happy to assist us to make sure we got to the airport when we needed to.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay on the Near North side”
Reviews.Author: JAH43
Reviews.Content: I was in a corner room with one double bed (as reserved), and everything was clean and comfortable. Though the room was not spacious, it was ample for my needs, with an adequately comfortable chair and also a desk and desk chair. The wifi was free and worked well, and the bathroom facilities were fine. I would describe the hotel's overall style as a "well maintained classic" (rather than, say, modernistic or '50s-ish). If what you're looking for is a clean, agreeable and hassle-free stay, this is a good choice. The location, one block from Michigan Avenue and 6 minutes from the subway, also help make it a good place to stay while in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for Wayans Bros. & JZ, Good Enough for Me!”
Reviews.Author: Tuxmiller
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is conveniently located downtown near Michigan Ave. Ditka's restaurant is on the ground floor. The Wayans Brothers and JZ were checking in Look, this is an old-school hotel, similar in style (but not quality) to Waldorf in NYC. That means old-fashioned wood at check-in. Small & very, very slow elevator and small rooms. Check in was efficient and professional and I was able to get in my room early. I had a king-sized bed and the reason for the 4-star instead of 3-star is because of the superior mattress. Also, the shower pressure was good. Convenience is also a consideration for this rating as is the fact that I booked the room at $129. Had it been more expensive, the star rating would go down in relation to the value. Room is small, and somewhat claustrophobic. Wallpaper is peeling in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Fine Mess”
Reviews.Author: Zelig A
Reviews.Content: Hotwire promised a 3 star experience with The Tremont located in the Gold Coast of Chicago. A terrible hotel is what I found. Management is not paying attention to the decay of the building. Black mold was present in the hotel room bathroom, found on the ceiling and walls. There was no heat for the entire building except for the hotel lobby. Front desk personnel said that no heat would be turned on until October 15th; despite night time air hovering in the 40's. Walls are extremely thin and ordinary conversation could be over heard. Furthermore the doors and posts of other hotel rooms on the floor I stayed on have settled causing the doors to make excessive noise when occupants returned or departed from their rooms; literally could hear someone entering their room from clear down a hallway. Hotwire should be ashamed for this misrepresentation and management should immediately take corrective measures.

Reviews.Title: “outdated, uncomfortable, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: jesstiles
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff didn't greet me once, despite coming and going at least 4 times in 24 hours. The rooms are outdated and the bed uncomfortable. Parking is $49 a night. Overall, not worth what you pay whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Totally a disappointment . . .”
Reviews.Author: ITravel286
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at the Tremont upon recommendation of a couple of acquaintances. We were very disappointed upon arriving at the hotel. It is in desperate need of updating and ambiance. The only way we would go back to the hotel is if it were updated and prices were lowered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lorhin
Reviews.Content: The front staff are friendly and most are extremely helpful. My room was great and the bed was super comfy. Hotel is a mere 1 min stroll to the Magnificent Mile. Some great value restaurants nearby. Hop On Hop Off Sightseeing Bus has a stop at end of street so very convenient! Better than great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Affordable Hotel Right Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Whitby-Gourmands
Reviews.Content: The hotel has that old world charm, and is cozy with very friendly staff. Location is perfect - a 2 minute walk from Michigan Ave. - The Magnificent Mile, and right around the corner from the Rush St. blues bars and dining area. Stash the car ( fyi - overnight parking is around $50 ! ) and go everywhere on foot. Ditka's Restaurant is open for breakfast and is attached to the hotel so no need to go anywhere. Only downside to the Tremont - no in-room coffee-maker. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. We had a great time and will stay again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Old Hotel; Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: JayJayPG
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 5 nights in this hotel for a week long getaway in downtown Chicago. The location is absolutely perfect if you plan on spending a lot of your time on or around Michigan Ave. or The Loop. This hotel was close enough to everything we wanted to see and do that we just walked everywhere and didn't even use public transportation. The hotel itself is charmingly outdated, but clean and very well kept (they were actually repainting the lobby towards the end of our stay). Front desk and housekeeping staff were extremely polite and accomodating. We had a king size bed which took up most of the space in the room, but there was still ample space for all of our luggage. The bathroom had also been updated and was spacious and relatively clean. I can't imagine anyone not having a pleasant stay here unless they paid full price and/or were expecting 4 star accomodations. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Doodle
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Tremont. Both visits have been pleasant. Quiet rooms, great location near both North Michigan Ave (for those who like to shop) and Rush Street (for those who like nightlife). The only downside is the elevators are a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel but fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Susan3181959
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay in Chicago one night so we wanted something on the Magnificent Mile and in easy walking distance to restaurants and shopping. The location can't be beat! It is right by Water Tower and has Dick Butkus's restaurant, Ditka's, on the main floor. The accommodations are older and the rooms very small but comfortable. It is a little pricey for the accommodations but considering the location it is somewhere we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious yet cozy”
Reviews.Author: petraqrsq
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very centrally located, just a 2 minute walk from the Hancock Tower and right on the Magnificent Mile. My suite had 2 bathrooms, one with a separate shower and bathtub, was full of antiques, and had an amazing view. The only thing I did not like was the breakfast. Not much choice at all (but I suppose that is the standard for the States)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and cosy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Men188590
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is a nice hotel. The service is very friendly, the interior of the rooms is a little bit old-fashioned, but rooms are spacious and clean. And to mention the location; very good! Almost at Michigan Ave and close to all shops. For the Loop and Millennium Park; take the bus or a cab. The only drawback was the elevator. Only one elevator for many floors (around 15 I think), so you might need to wait a while. And.. about the breakfast, cheap ($5) but very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Sara_941
Reviews.Content: Medium size old hotel located closed to Hanckhook tower, in the middle of the Gold Coast and Magnificient Mile in Chicago. Perfect to spend some days or a week to see the city. Cleaning service efficient, though decoration is old-fashioned. They offer a continental breakfast for 5 dollars that is good, with coffee to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: notdeconcentrate
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, staff pleasant, and the rooms had what was needed. Just a block off of Michigan Ave and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey194
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but the hotel itself was just old.....not a "classic" old either....just old.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: judezee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay at the Tremont Hotel in Chicago. The room was nice and clean. When you first open the door, the room looked small. However after you went further it was quite nice. THe bathroom had a separate sink and makeup mirror outside of the shower area. This was great because I could put my makeup on while my husband was showering. The staff were excellent. Sure you have to ask for ice, but they were very accomodating. One night after a late dinner, we were so thirsty, they went to their empolyee lounge and got us soft drinks. THe continental breakfast was not bad for $ 5.00. However, you are half block away from Michigan ave. THe location of this hotel was it's best feature. You are very close to Michigan ave. ALso several blocks from Rush street where there are many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, great location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Carolinde
Reviews.Content: I asked for a room on one of the top floors, but it was still very noisy. Apart from the air conditioning there was work going on outside, behind the church. Room was a good size, bur furniture rather old and chipped. Comfortable bed. Bathroom looked rather old, but was clean. Reception staff were extremely helpful!!! Also, the location of this hotel is very good, soooooo central. You can walk to any of the sights in Chicago's downtown area. And it's just around the corner from the Magnificent Mile! The hotel does not have any computers where you can just check something on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: lenchant60
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. One block from the Magnificent Mile-Water Tower Place-Buses on Michigan Ave. can take you anywhere, and two blocks from the train. My sixteen year old son and I stayed in the building across the alley, called Tremont Studios; each of us had brand new King beds, difficult to get my sixteen year old out of the bed as it was so "comfy." But, the shopping that surrounded us was a great incentive. The only negative, and it was hard to think of one, was they are old buildings, both the main hotel and studio building, so the elevator was a bit scary...I opted for the stairs. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. My son and I stayed eight days, and had a wonderful time. Would definitely stay again. For $5.00 extra a filling continental breakfast is provided at Ditkas restaurant , which also provides lunch and dinner for the public and guests. It was lovely to sit out front, people watch and have a martini at the end of the day. Also, I am a smoker, and this is a non-smoking hotel. Was able to have my nicotine fix with other smokers in an area in front of the hotel-where I met some lovely people from other states and countries. Also, some outdoor tables at Ditkas provided a smoking area when I indulged in my martini. A side note, though I didn't see him, some other guests informed me one morning that Mike Ditka was actually in the restaurant when they were there. Too many "finds" to name them all... But, one of my sons and my favorite was Cafe Tempo two blocks West on Chestnut. Open twenty four hours a day; they serve breakfast at all hours, to full dinners, sandwiches, homemade pies and cakes and a variety of smoothies- I think in the eight days we were in Chicago, my son tried a new one each day. When you book your stay at the Tremont keep in mind it's an older Chicago building, nothing modern, but, it's very reminiscent to a European style hotel. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Dogalicious
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to spend a lot of money on a hotel with a great location then this is the one for you. The hotel definitely needs some attention. Tiles missing on wall in bathroom, shower didn't drain very well etc. Staff is very nice. Starbucks is right across the street. When we are in Chicago we are only in our room to sleep for a few hours so we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Gets it 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: jcarr55
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect and worth the 5 stars. In between restaurants and nightlife of Rush street, and the shopping of North Michigan Ave (Magnficent Mile). We walked to Navy Pier as well, about 1 mile. And to the Beach. The bed is clean, the rooms are a bit outdated but who cares? We were there to see the city. John Hancock Tower was 1 block away. Go to 96th floor and get a cocktail to enjoy the view. Was about half the price of nearby hotels so I'd recommend. Staff was friendly. Tip: Walk to the Original Pancake House for breakfast, sit outside, and get a Dutch Apple Pancake.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago 55!”
Reviews.Author: Teatime565
Reviews.Content: Tremont is an older hotel that has character along with a friendly staff! The room was clean but a bit small. The location was great!!! Mike Ditka's restaurant is attached and offers a wonderful menu!!! It also provided the eating area for the continental breakfast !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: twarden
Reviews.Content: The reservationist was extremely helpful in making sure that I had a booking here for an otherwise sold-out conference at the Westin just around the corner. The accommodations were modest to nice, but an extremely good value for the location after my AAA discount (better than the Westin.) The rooms manager, Giovanni, was extraordinarily helpful in managing a special billing pre-arrangement based on our business account and the front desk clerk upgraded us to a king bed without our asking when she saw I was pregnant. We were thankful for complimentary wireless internet. The only downside was that our room was a bit warm (when temps were high 90s outside), but we would certainly stay there again! Location and access to everything on the Magnificent Mile was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: djrIndependenceIowa
Reviews.Content: Its a great place stay because the people there are great. The shopping is within walking distance . The restaurants are great and close. It just a great piace

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Gillianandco
Reviews.Content: Very good for price paid. Bar next door excellent food and very busy. Had two different rooms as needed a lower floor as do not do lifts. Staff changed our room for us on day two and moved all our stuff. Both rooms were fine, the first one a little larger and had a view of lake (just) but new building next door may stop this Very helpful staff, room and bathroom clean, furniture a little tired but that just added to the character. Bed really comfy. Stairwells a little scruffy but most people use the lift. Would deffinatley stay again and would reccomend to anyone even my very picky sister

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst”
Reviews.Author: jmarieweaver
Reviews.Content: Cons: Our first room had water damage that was completely unimaginable. It looked like a monster growing out of the wall. Our second room was just as bad. Don't let the website pictures fool you. There was brown wall paper peeling off, furniture with the paint worn off. The bedding doesn't match. It is like a Amityville Horror. Absolutely not a hotel I recommend using until they update the place. It is way past unacceptable. I can't believe it's a member of the Starwood Hotels program. It gives the brand a bad name. Pros: The staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for a somewhat tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: cotney
Reviews.Content: Snagged an $88/night rate so I knew not to expect over-the-top. Clean room with comfy king bed. Wood furnishings are scuffed up but functional. Not much for amenities. Also a bit short-staffed as there was only one front desk clerk who also handled concierge requests (like if there was an in-house ice machine. We never found one.) the good news is the fabulous location. We didn't spend much time in the room!

Reviews.Title: “run down”
Reviews.Author: Khaton13
Reviews.Content: Most 3 star hotels are being upgraded but this one is definitely going downhill. The elevator barely works. There isn't enough staff. It isn't very secure. The rooms are noisy. The best thing about the hotel is the location but there are plenty of other places to stay nearby.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy AC in July, don't bother staying here!”
Reviews.Author: MargauxLippoldt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago with friends for a ling weekend. We booked the hotel through a travel agent, so we thought it woul be decent. We were excited when the cab dropped us off, so close to Michigan Avenue! We dropped our bags off before exploring the city ad turned the thermostat down in our stuffy, dirty corner room. We were surprised when we returned 10 hours later and the room was still hot. Neither of us slept solid that night as the room was probably 78-80 degrees, no exaggeration. The next day, we asked the front desk to send someone to fix our AC on 3 different occasions throughout the day. We returned for bed that night, again to a hot room. We asked again the next day and nothing was ever done. On top of that, the carpet and all interiors are old ad dingy. The shower tile grout was growing with black mold. The pictures you see posted are no exaggeration. Great location, awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Holly-Bella11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. You are half a block of Michigan Ave. The front desk was friendly and helpful and allowed us to check in early and check out late without an additional charge. The room was clean but small, I don't expect a large room when I'm visiting since I don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. The furniture was a little worn, some scratches and there was only a night stand on one side of the bed which made it a little harder for the person on that side. The breakfast is okay ($5 charge) but there is a Starbucks accross the street which was great if you wanted better coffee, no coffee maker in the room. Biggest complaint which is really not that big is that there are no vending machines in the building so if you want a bottle of water or soda you have to walk 2 blocks to get one. Also, no ice makers but if you want ice the front desk will get you some. There is a restaurant attached but we never ate there.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job as a base for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: SirNed85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a side street, just 50 yds off the main thoroughfare of N Michigan Avenue (The Magnificent Mile). It's discreet, narrow, canopied frontage, complete with a porter to help with your bags or hail you a cab leads into a 30s style entrance hall and comfortable lounge which conveys its own character and charm. Just one elevator serves the approx 14 floors of rooms, so be prepared to wait (unless you find the service elevator, hidden at ground floor level behind a door). The rooms are comfortable and adequate. The hotel dining room is operated by 'Iron Mike' Ditka, fabled ex coach of the Chicago Bears NFL team. Good, but pricey lunchtime and evening food (eat instead at the excellent Le Petit Paris, less than 10 mins walk east on Chestnut St, see separate review) and the breakfast is simple, to say the least but at $5, what can you expect? The staff on hotel reception were incredibly helpful when I had problems checking in for my flight, spending 30 minutes online and phoning to sort it out on my behalf. This was service way beyond expectations from a busy city centre hotel and why I would recommend anybody to stay at this excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel in need of a face lift”
Reviews.Author: september04
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I took a trip to Chicago in May 2011 for a romantic weekend together. It was our first time to visit the beautiful ' Windy City'. We booked a room online at the Tremont Hotel. They did gave us a good rate for the room compared to the other hotels on the magnificent mile but when we arrived we where disappointed. The room was very, very small & the decor really outdated. The location is great but the hotel is old and needs a serious face lift. We still had an amazing weekend together and enjoyed our time in Chicago. We plan to take another trip there again but we will choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: NYCDave66
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, comfortable rooms and very reasonably priced. Very friendly and helpful staff. Only drawback - only one (slow) elevator. A great place for enjoying Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for food & shopping.”
Reviews.Author: MissMichele26
Reviews.Content: Read other reviews. I'm in a king room. Very clean, adequate size, everything works fine. Starbucks right across street (room coffee always sucks anyway). Tv works just fine and there's a clock in our room. On the 7th floor facing an alley, but helps with city noise. Great blackout drapes and room stays cool. I would stay here again. I ALWAYS believe it's helpful to call hotels the day before and talk to desk clerk; check your room-ask for upgrade (especially if downing a whole week) notify if you have late check-in, & small chit-chat. That way they should know when you walk through door. Oh, do self park 2 blocks away and save $36 compared to $49! And a tip about shower... Let the water run in the tub so you pull water up to your room and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in middle of mag mile”
Reviews.Author: Aussie22GoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Cute old hotel, basic facilities but very good location for the price. There was construction going on at the back of hotel but only during the day and if you only wany a place to sleep, then this will do. Would be good if a mini fridge or microwave was supplied, otherwise, no complaints, nice and clean, nice staff

Reviews.Title: “OK but have encountered better”
Reviews.Author: chowhound03
Reviews.Content: On the plus side you can't beat the location. Just about 1/2 block off of N. Michigan Avenue's Miracle Mile. Also the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Ditka's Steakhouse adjoining was convenient and top-notch. Some downsides--This place is older, small rooms, and needs some renovating. Furniture in room badly nicked, scratched and worn. Some wallpaper peeling off walls. Large crack in bathroom sink. A lot of early morning noise from the neighborhood--trash trucks emptying dumpsters, machine (sounded like leaf blower or chain saw), and dogs barking. Also, parking was $48/night, and they charge $5 for a bare bones continental breakfast as well as $3.00 per bag/suitcase that is held for check in or checkout. Have never experienced these petty extra charges for small things that are normally included. Would have been very disappointed if I had paid much more, but for the under $100 deal offered on the Internet it was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal, but comfortable and convenient hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: July43210000
Reviews.Content: Delta airlines gave us great package that included flight and three nights at Tremont at a very reasonable price. Tremont is an old apartment building from the 1920's converted to a hotel. As it happens in such cases, it has charm, but few modern amenities. The lobby in the front was lovely and the hotel is conveniently located just north of the Miracle Mile, but lacks a restaurant or room service. The so called "complementary" continental breakfast is in the adjacent restaurant "Ditka's" (yes, Da Bears fame) and costs $5! Go figure! There is free internet and TV in the rooms, but little else. And the remote on the TV did not work properly. I could not turn TV on or off with it and could not access pay-per-view channels. Also, no coffee maker. Luckily, there is a Starbucks across the street. Our 15th floor room was decent size, with an odd shaped bathroom. The shower was fine, but again nothing unusual. The best thing about the hotel is that it is close to shopping on Michigan Avenue and only a five minute walk from the "red line". We bought a 3 day pass for $14 each to get around Chicago. A great value! We got to and from Midway airport with it and used it on trains and buses including going up to Evanston.

Reviews.Title: “Old-world Feel, Great Location, No Kids, No Teens Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: aprilasinapril
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were pretty new to Chicago so we chose to stay down-town and be close to shopping and restaurants. The Tremont was charming, lots of dark, rich wood, fun older elevator that actually didn't make me sea sick b/c it moves so slowly! If we could offer a tip it would be look into the room size- a few rooms are on the corners of the hotel and they are like twice the size of the other rooms! We lucked out and got a big one without knowing and then we saw many of the others when they were being cleaned and they were all so much smaller! Oh, and the hotel recently replaced all of their mattresses, the sleeping was very cozy. FYI you have to go to the front desk for ice. They have black-out curtains; we slept in every day and it felt like night!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tanderra77
Reviews.Content: Staying at the tremont right now and still another 2 nights location is a 10/10 Hotel room is very clean staff are nice they gave us an upgrade to king with city view. Only prob is no coffee makers!!!!, and nothing to close to get coffee. But would still recommend this hotel for the price with its location its a steal

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: shan_luv2travel
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is in a fantastic location for shopping at 900 N Michigan or Water Tower Place or going out in the city. The service by the staff was very pleasant and we had no issues. The valet stand attendants were great in getting us cabs and tending to our luggage. The room we stayed in was on the smaller side, the bathroom needed updating (especially the paper thin towels!), but the one main drawback was how thin the walls were. To not feel like a voyeur, I had to turn on the old tv to drown out the romantic activities of our neighbors. That was a bit uncomfortable. The price paid was reasonable (use AAA) for the city, but watch out for the outrageous valet charges for cars ($49/day). This is pretty typical I found out, but still, it's a lot of money! We also really enjoyed the food and hospitality at Mike Ditka's restaurant, attached to the Tremont. Overall, if you won't spend much time in your room, this might be a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan60785
Reviews.Content: This was our first Thanksgiving family get away in Chicago. Booked 3 rooms for grown children and ourselves. We got a great price through AAA for a busy holiday week-end. Great views of the Magnificent Mile. Enjoyed the historical character of the hotel inside and out. A great place to stay if you plan to be out in the city most of the time. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean. Although the furniture appeared to be well worn, it added to the charm and character of the hotel. Ditka's Restaurant next door served a great lunch and dinner. Well worth the cost! We would certainly stay there again if we had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly treated guest”
Reviews.Author: nc817vil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overrated and deserves only 2 stars. It does not have ice machine, and exagerated # of room occupancy. Rooms are old, wallpaper peeling off, and pipes noisy at night. The manager & front desk clerk are uncompassionate, inhumane, disriminating and liars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Dante46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tremont a few weeks ago and must say that it is a fantastic location with a good price for the area. The hotel was somewhat old and had a very slow elevator, but served my needs. The beds were solid as a rock, which was uncomfortable, but that is the worst thing I have to say about the place. They are near the subway and the miracle mile. Stop by pippins pub a few blocks away if you get a chance - and have a hot dog next door!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...But Hotel Needs MANY Updates...”
Reviews.Author: MMLmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a trip to Chicago as a mini getaway without the kids. I got a great deal on the room, at $150/night, through Hotwire.com and let's just say I'm glad I did...I wouldn't have paid any more for this hotel. Upon arriving, we were very pleased with the location. You can't get any better as far as that goes. The Tremont is located right at the start of the Magnificent Mile and was very central to everything we wanted to do. Attractions, restaurants, and shopping are all within walking distance or a short cab ride away. We enjoyed this aspect of our stay very much. We parked our car valet and were very pleased with John, the concierge. He was very friendly and attentive to his duties. The rest of the staff was very accommodating and friendly throughout our stay as well. Some of the other reviewers seemed to have had less luck in this aspect stating rude staff...however this was not our experience at all. When entering the hotel, it seems nice enough...lots of historical character and charm; but I didn't feel that way so much about the room itself. Our room was a standard king size room and left a lot to be desired. It felt dark, dirty, and very outdated and while I am not a prude in this area, I did find it interesting that several of the more standard amenities were left out (i.e. alarm clock and hair dryer). The light in the bathroom was attached to the fan and was extremely noisy and the shower had a slow drain so you were standing in a couple inches of water while showering. The king size bed was very uncomfortable. A thin mattress you could feel the springs through and the sheets just had a scratchy feel and were yellowed. I am truly not a complainer and hate writing up a negative review, as the staff were so nice. I just feel if they took the time to update and repair some areas of the hotel it would be absolutely perfect as the location is to die for. My husband and I stayed only the one night, getting in late (after dinner, a Broadway show, and drinks out) and left early the following morning; therefore we strictly used the hotel for sleeping only...while sleep was an elusive term that evening, I would recommend this hotel if you're not planning to stay in it much as the location makes up for some of the other areas it fails in. As you can see, I'm left a bit conflicted about our stay at The Tremont...

Reviews.Title: “Tired and shabby... but a great location”
Reviews.Author: SenorVP
Reviews.Content: I appreciated the accuracy of most of the reviews here regarding the Tremont. It tempered our expectations. Service was OK. A bit disorganized. The public areas are decent. They just have a slightly "off" feel. The room was clean, but shabby. Sheets were crisp and spotless. Bathroom was clean and smelled of disinfectant; not a bad thing in my book. But the wallpaper was peeling and the furniture was worn. These guys should visit the Talbott a block over. When we began staying at the Talbott 25 years ago, it was a bit like the Tremont. (Though, at the time, it was an all-suite hotel with kitchens in every suite!) It had just been turned from apartments. The owner there has done an astonishing job of upgrading it. It is now arguable one of the nicest hotels in Chi-town. The Tremont has similar potential as it, too, is just steps from the Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Not to Starwood standards”
Reviews.Author: Cleanqueen035
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Starwood Hotels loyalty program, thinking that would guarantee a standard we are familiar with. Not so. Though described as "historic," it has none of the lovely time-worn patina we had expected--it is just tired, shabby and down-at-the-heels. Peeling wallpaper, damaged walls, cracked sink, missing grout and broken tiles in the shower all added up to a less than satisfactory experience. The room was clean enough, I guess, but it needs some updating NOW because the overall feel is one of dinginess. The seat in the one reading chair is long past its best-before date--it felt like you would fall through the bottom. And the television was about the same vintage as the hotel. Its one saving grace was the wonderful location, just a minute's walk to the mag mile. Really disappointed to find this under the Starwood banner.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced, fun place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: peg_waite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for the first time. When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite, much to our surprise and delight. We were on the 16th floor with a skyline view of the city. Very roomy, fireplace, 2 baths. The hotel is older and has a lot of charm. The lobby connects with Mike Ditka's resturant. A continental breakfast was served there each morning. The resturant is filled with sports memerobilia. A must see for sports fans. The staff was courteous and helpful, directing us to Wrigley Field via the subway and to nightspots for dinner and music. There's also a Starbucks right across the street for those who need their morning latte. One drawback, no coffer maker in our room. There was some early morning noise due to street repairs being done in front of the hotel. We'd definetly return if we ever go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: solomiata
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Tremont 4 times now over the last 2 years for weekend getaways. Love it. Perfect for the romantic weekend trip. Location could not be better. Price is reasonable. Staff very nice. Will continue to be a repeat guest. RS. Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BPReed
Reviews.Content: The Tremont provides a perfect hotel experience for those of us who travel to visit the grand city of Chicago (in other words, not staying in the room all day)! As other reviews commented, the room is a bit dingy however the bed is very comfortable and the bath is adequate. The staff is friendly, professional and extremely helpful. They are concerned about making our stay as comfortable as possible. There seems to be a focus on obtaining customer feedback and addressing any needs promptly. There is only one elevator for the guests to use - which prompted me to walk down the 11 flights one time as opposed to wait for the elevator. Also, our room did not have any extra electrical outlets - so we rotated the charging of our cell phones and computers. But these are minor inconvenences given the location and the staff. A word of warning if you have a car - parking is extremely costly in Chicago, and the Tremont is not exception ($49/day for valet). Bus and train service can take you anywhere though and there are taxis readily accessable outside the hotel. I will stay here again without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location is only positive, and free Wi-Fi I guess.”
Reviews.Author: Iowamy
Reviews.Content: Parking is very close, easy to walk anywhere, staff was nice and helpful to us. Room was awful, furniture needs to be replaced its falling apart and the mirror was broken. Bed was beyond hard you could feel the springs and metal frame. Rips in chair tops of tables were ruined, wall paper was peeling in bathroom and cabinet was in bad shape. Bathroom also smelled like sewer gas entire trip. Windows were very drafty I would hate to stay in winter you would freeze. Pillow also smelled like smoke. Hallway and elevator while clean were all in need of repairs. Elevator took forever and shook like crazy. Lobby was clean and charming. I get it this is a small old hotel but there is no excuse for the state of disrepair this hotel is in. This hotel should be a one star at most and then only for its location, and the price, for the condition its in, should be under $60 a night regardless of how close it is to the Mag Mile. Will not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware of room 307”
Reviews.Author: nancebe
Reviews.Content: We arrived by car. The valet was wonderful-- he really worked hard to please. The front desk person was not very friendly. Our room had a bad odor in the bathroom(my husband said it smelled like sewer gas). The paint was peeling on the wall near the toilet. We did not request a change of room(we should have). If we had paid more for the room I would have definitely asked for a change. We did not spend much time in the room. The location was fabulous--we were able to walk to great restaurants and entertainment. We had a continental breakfast provided. We ate there the first day but went over to Starbucks for the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: jsb712
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the train on the way back to Michigan, so it is fresh in my mind. The tremont hotel is in a great location, it is about 200 feet from the magnificent mile, very close to the water tower, perfect for using public transportation, I mean it is a great location for w tourist. And that is the only thing great I can say about this place. Don't get me wrong, its not a terrible hotel, its pretty clean, although a bit dated, the front desk staff was never very friendly, but they were not rude either. But the rooms are small, about 10 tv channels, not much of s view from our room, and street noise could be loud. Only 1 elevator was a problem, sometimes it was quick, other times we waited 5 to 10 minutes for it. No ice bucket? I'll sum it up. If you want a room just to sleep in, that you will spend no time in, that is in a wonderful location, then stay here. I think a 3 star rating is generous, but the neighborhood felt very safe. Finally, do not pay their full price rate listed on their website, there are many better options out there, this place is only worth it if you get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room”
Reviews.Author: Terapi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location but the room smelled like a sewer. In addition, I got locked in the bathroom for over an hour. Maintenance had to come and remove part of the door. I left a complaint with management and still have not heard back. This is not the service I expected from a 3 star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: kdc4
Reviews.Content: The whole place is dirty. I dont mind the dated decor so much as the SOILED chairs and bedcovers, the MOLDY air vents, and the cobweb filled stairs that you are forced to take because there's only one elevator. Dont be fooled by the hotel posted photos, this place is gross! Service doesnt make up for it - it actually made the experience worse. The front desk agent literally hid in a room for (no exaggeration) an hour while five groups of guests waited for her to address us. I think she thought that maybe we would just go away, but one group was waiting for their car, two separate groups were waiting to check out, and our two groups were waiting to check in! We tried knocking on the door, and calling the front desk via the house phone and she ignored us. I wandered around the hotel - and kitchen - looking for someone to help. It was pretty ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “A cool and classy place - and great location.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyC_in_Tennessee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel based on the reviews found here. We were looking for something near the Magnificent Mile and the Navy Pier. We also booked 3 other rooms for friends we were meeting there. The hotel was great, staff very friendly, and the rooms very clean. The location was very convenient to everything we did. Because I was booking a hotel for a group, I was a little nervous about pleasing everyone. Everyone in our group was highly complementary of the hotel and the staff. This is a small, classy, quaint hotel. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: palehose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Tremont Hotel in 2008 and again last week. In '08 the room was in need of a coat of paint but this trip I was in room 1508 and it was neat as a pin. I booked on gtahotel.com and paid $101 a night including all taxes. The location is second to none. 5 minutes to subway, 2 minutes to Michigan Ave&water tower. You can get a continental breakfast at Mike Ditka's for $5. No bargain here but this is of course Chicago. If I travel to Chicago again, the Tremont will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints, But Not Impressed Either”
Reviews.Author: LSETerp
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a night in this hotel, and while we had a positive experience it wasn't really anything to write home about. When we first got in they were having a problem with their computer system so people were being given rooms that had not been cleaned yet, but the staff were doing their best to keep everyone happy and get it sorted out. When we got to our room it was pretty basic, but a decent size with a nice view of the surrounding area. Everything was clean, though some of the paint and wallpaper was starting to show its age. There's nothing I can really complain about, but there's also nothing that stands out as being particularly exceptional. It's in a great location on a relatively quiet street, the staff were friendly and helpful, and everything worked in the room. I will say that we only got about six TV channels, and the sheets on the bed were a little thin. The walls are also fairly thin so we could hear occasionally hear the family next door, though not enough to really be a bother. Overall, I would recommend staying here but only if you don't have to pay full price for a room. If you're used to gleaming new facilities and cutting edge technology, this isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for something different with a bit of character, this is a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn but great location”
Reviews.Author: jaymama
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that shows its age in wear and tear but we found it clean and acceptable. The location close to Michigan Ave Magnificent Mile is great, right across from Hancock Tower. Our main complaint is the old elevator of which there is only ONE. It won't budge if there are more than 6 people in it. We noticed a service elevator and started using it with no problem. Also, there is no coffee maker in the room. So, if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel with great location but not much in the way of decor, this is for you. DON'T waste money on the continental breakfast at Ditka' s next door----it's awful!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique, European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taylorcat2us
Reviews.Content: I'd booked the Tremont from an online site with not much of an idea of what I'd find. The rates, under $100/night were great. The hotel was ADORABLE. The small reception area is very like the one at my favorite hotel in Paris. The hall lounge is beautiful with dark beamed high ceilings, a grand piano, fireplace, beautiful leather furniture and charming little art objects. Our room was small but the view was directly looking at the Hancock building and a small wedge of Lake Michigan. Just a short walk away from Lake Michigan and great shopping right on Miracle Mile. H&M was practically around the corner as was Ralph Lauren's and the Water Tower. Convenient to bus and rail that will take you almost anywhere you want to go. An amazingly great choice. There is a nice spa across the street too. Entrance lounge is Elegant, rooms are small with European charm. All the charm and quiet sleep you could want but close to everything. Starbuck's is just across the street. Clubs around one corner, shopping around the other corner. Definitely do not miss lunch or dinner at DITKA's which shares the address with the Tremont. The $5 breakfast the hotel serves there is something I didn't try, but dinner was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mondial82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. The manager was extremely friendly and the location can't be beat for the price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Chicago, "historic" interior”
Reviews.Author: wiggerl089
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is not a five star hotel, so you cannot expect five star luxury. The hotel is nicely located near Hancock Tower just a few yards off Michigan Avenue. The hotel is called historic, that means that the interior is not brand new and clean as new. I found broken tyles in the bathroom and a lot of cigarette holes in the blanket on my bed. I had two channels on TV that worked, but I stayed at the hotel for business purposes and not to watch TV. The interior is decorated in a special style that is definitely not mine (I am more on the Ritz Carlton side if my company pays for it). I got used to staying at the Tremont after a few days as I just came into my room late at night and for a very short sleep. The buffet breakfast costs 5 dollars and is a cheaper alternative to Starbucks on the other side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: DLP53
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at The Tremont simply because it was the closest hotel to my son's apartment. I booked a one queen bed room, 185 square feet, for $89 plus tax. That was all I needed as I was travelling by myself and staying only one night. When I checked in, the desk clerk said "We've upgraded your room - I hope you like it." I took the (yes, small and rattly) elevator to the 16th floor, found my room, and opened the door. My jaw dropped. They had given me a king suite on the top floor with huge windows overlooking Michigan Ave. and the area around Hancock Center! It was spotlessly clean and absolutely beautiful. This was an especially wonderful treat for me on Mother's Day weekend. They were even giving all the Moms a small box of chocolates. I'm an ordinary traveller - no one special. I had never set foot in The Tremont before. I don't know what happened or how I got lucky on this trip. But it says something about a hotel when they give you an unexpected bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: RedHon
Reviews.Content: Outdated can be cozy, but dirt and filth are unacceptable. Don't waste your money here there are hotels in the area around the same rate that are far more accommodating, and most certainly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Shopkeepers
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is an older hotel with a great location in downtown Chicago. While the rooms and elevator are small, we found The Tremont clean and quiet. The little box of chocolates for Mother's Day was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: wktravelers
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tremont Hotel in Chicago and I had a WONDERFUL expierence... the hotel is centrally located, the rooms were clean and quiet, and the customer service was 5 star.. everyone was very helpful and friendly. Omar you're the best! I highly recommend this hotel.. The value was unbeatable. Thanks again Tremont Staff. See you next time! Lee

Reviews.Title: “Great location; front desk workers don't seem knowledgeable about city”
Reviews.Author: amyhearttravel
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It's in a quiet location only a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The room was very nice. My only complaint is that the front desk workers did not speak good English and did not seem knowledgeable. Luckily I had my ipod and was able to look location of places up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STL57
Reviews.Content: Okay, let me just say my husband and I stayed at the Tremont during Christmas. We had a great experience, will DEFINITELY be back very soon. Not sure what some of the negative reviews mean.....please do not base your decision on the negativity of some people.

Reviews.Title: “decrepit and dirty”
Reviews.Author: MidwestSignorina
Reviews.Content: Definitely a miss and rooms in no way resemble room pictured on web site, etc. The drapery was missing -replaced by dirty gaping mini linds. Carpet was stained, walls were banged up and peeling, bathroom had mismatched dim lighting, moldy shower curtain etc. When we turned the heat on - it smelled awful and chugged like a freight train. After seeing the dirty walls - and the FILTHY vent & ceiling around it - we checked out. They offered us another room which was equally bad. No way we could have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: cajunstar
Reviews.Content: We love to stay in these nostalgic hotels, but I would classify this one as a miss. It's saving grace is it's location - right off the Mile and within easy walking distance of the subway, but... We were disappointed in the quality of the room. Heating/AC is all or nothing - in this case all heat. To get any air circulation without turning on the heat, we had to open the window - and since it was a rainy couple of days, that was problematic. Without the window cracked open, it got a but stifling in the room. Bed was a miss as well - a little too hard. And the only real covering on the window - mini-blinds, so no sleeping in was not possible. We also found getting our car from valet was a hit or miss proposition. More often than not, the valet station was unoccupied. All in all, not what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for those that want to see the city and won't need lots of room time”
Reviews.Author: ktorres2
Reviews.Content: im from So. Cal and took this trip with two of my friends over spring break. I know, not they typical destination for spring break, but we thought we'd try something completely different with weather total opposite of sunny CA so we picked Chicago and I can now say it was a perfect choice! We arrived at this hotel and the staff greeted us with a smile and were very courteous. The location was AMAZING too. Right in the middle of everything, a few steps (literally) away from the John Hancock building, and one block from michigan avenue (a shopaholics PARADISE). We got to our room (one queen bed) and scoped out the place. The bathroom was perfect for us. Great size, clean, big mirrors, lots of drawers to store our stuff.. just great! The room on the other hand, was a little grandma like. The decor/colors were kind of bland, nothing too modern and exciting, but we couldnt complain because it was clean, spacious, everything we needed. We had a tv, safe to store our stuff, but no microwave/mini fridge or anything. We got the room for a GREAT price though so we really couldnt complain and plus we ate out most of the time so we really didnt need the extra stuff. Wealso got complimentary bfast with our stay and that was pretty good and a great way to kick off our day. It wasnt anything special (bagels, toast, juice, cereal, fruit, coffee), but it was good nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - quirky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KarenHaston
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine - the staff full of smiles and friendly. Our room was very clean - old tv - curtains etc but spotless! One thing missing though... No tea or coffee in the room - first time in all years of travel has this not been part of 'the room' We went to Starbucks before bed and in the morning for drinks and brought them back to the room - not to far away. On site eatery which was fairly priced - again very quaint - dark lighting - nice though. Lacation couldn't have been better - so that makes up for all else as really how much time do you spend in your hotel room? Lastly - take your own toiletries as the ones they have in the room are a bit over perfumed - no shampoo and only hard soap - In general - Go for it - it sure is quirky and nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: mill1469
Reviews.Content: The Tremont hotel is the perfect hotel for people who are going to be out and about in the city, and don't plan on spending much time in the hotel and therefore don't need a 5 star room. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Tremont for 3 nights in August during Lollapalooza, and it was exactly what we needed. We got a deal for $99 on Hotwire. The Tremont is in the best location in Chicago, right off of Michigan Ave near the Hancock building. There is a Red line metro stop within walking distance and plenty of cabs available. The hotel is definitely a smaller hotel and the rooms are not huge but very clean, and there is a king size bed, large bathroom and large closet- for those who are planning on being out on the town a lot, what more do you really need? Certainly the bathroom and decor isn't the newest and some improvements would make the hotel look a little nicer- but for $100 a night in downtown Chicago, I'll gladly deal with the 1980's looking bathroom! Our room was on the 4th floor so we were able to get internet service in our room, which was nice because we used MetroMix.com a lot to pick out restaurants and activities. You can also use Google Maps to see metro lines. Also, instead of using the valet for $49 a day we parked a block away at the 900 N. Michigan Avenue shop garage self park behind the Bloomingdales for only $34/day. My suggestion is that if you are coming to Chicago to walk around and spend time in the city, then this hotel is perfect for the money. If you are looking to spend more time relaxing and in the actual hotel room then sure, maybe you want to spend more money. For my needs, this was a great deal and in an expensive city like Chicago it's nice to save some money wherever you can!

Reviews.Title: “A nice modest sized hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: InnerLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late May/early June for 4 nights. Was somewhat worried given the mixed reviews on here. Paid $80 a night via priceline and felt I bagged a bargain when I turfed up at the hotel. Hotel has a nice quiet attractive lobby - a pleasant lounge to the left hand side has a nice smart period look to it and is a great place for people to wait for you. Front desk staff were very pleasant - what is great about this hotel is it's not huge so it means things like the front desk are not overrun with 50 people all trying to get service. every time I needed to go the front desk there were no other guests around so you got great informative service from the staff. Staff also were locally knowledgeable on places to eat and different places for drinks. Hotel is in a perfectly nice set of streets - cannot understand what the reference in a review here to begging. Never saw any. It is also a matter of 100 yards or so to the magnificent mile - at the Hancock building and very close to all the malls. Room itself was perfectly fine and moderately spacious - with easy chairs to sit on and a writing desk as well as good storage. Was surprised how smart the decor was - never switched on the TV but then I rarely do - you're in a great city so why would you. Bathroom was serviceable - perhaps slightly dated in look but I wasn't complaining at the price - shower was great - a veritable gushing shower. everything clean and tidy. Also the free wireless everywhere in the hotel including the rooms was a boon. There is use of a not great gym in a much bigger hotel nearby - if you really need the gym I'd suggest finding somewhere better but then you're paying very little for the hotel so could stretch to a day pass to a bigger gym. Breakfast was reasonable - not posh or much of a spread but coffee bagels and cereals - enough to set you up to get out the door but not something to savour and spend time over. All told I would heartily recommend this hotel particularly amazing value at $80 - much nicer to me than staying in some massive 1000 room type place where the lobby is mobbed by conference guests the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff...can't beat location”
Reviews.Author: jillybeansxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 31-Aug 2 weekend. What a great hotel. Right off Michigan Avenue and connected to Ditka's restaurant (go there). Metro was close, you could walk to the water easily...safe neighborhood. Antonia was the best!! Great employee and very sweet. Really enjoyed our stay...would def. stay there again

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamTheriot
Reviews.Content: what have people got to complain about. the hotel was great and the breakfast was excellent and more than enough.yes the telly was poor but do you come on holiday to watch tv.We saw no beggers and not once did two females feel at threat when we came back late at night.The location was right and chicago was easy to get round.Stop complaining and stay at this great hotel well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bad breakfast, bad location”
Reviews.Author: TheElegantMoose
Reviews.Content: Continental breakfast either did not open on time, had no coffee, and always had the lowest quality bagels, muffins, etc. you can imagine. Location is right in the middle of Chicago's homeless/begging district and is rather unpleasant. Room was clean and nice though.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: iLOVEmyDOGSs
Reviews.Content: we were two girls (both 18) staying at the hotel for 5 days, and we had the most amazing stay. the room was big, and we enjoyed being in it, bathroom was big enough, and breakfast was good. the younger guy in the reception was great, he helped us find everyhing we needed, and was always up for a chat. I can only recommend this hotel, one of my best hotel experiences (I've travelled a lot though i'm still kind of young)! only downside was the grumpy old lady in the mornings. she did NOT like us at all!!!! don't know why though, she would barely even answer us if we needed some help! oh, and the dark haired girl (with a little bit of an accent) was really grat too!!! if anyone from the hotel ever gets to read this: THANK YOU FOR A GREAT STAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but declining”
Reviews.Author: jeneric717
