Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Tremont many times in the past 10 years, and it seems to be slowly slipping. It's still reasonably nice and definitely a good value. But updates are needed. Our tv was old with poor color and sound. Very few channels. Not a room you would want to spend time in. The Tremont used to be very nice, now is adequate. The location is still awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chief4ever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just a block off of Michigan Avenue and a couple blocks from the Red Line train. My wife and I went on a trip there with some friends and had a great time. We planned a trip to Wrigley Field and the Tremont is so close to the Red Line and that makes it easier than having to drive all over Chicago. It is an older hotel, but we looked online for a good deal and got one. When booking online, make sure you look at all of the rates and promotions and pick the best deal. We got this hotel for around $100 and could not be happier with the value that came with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yerac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fine for the price and even better if you can get a deal. The el is close by as are lots of shops. The Hancock Tower is just down the road. Good to have a drink on the 95th floor. Breakfast is good and the staff are friendly and helpful. The only quibble is we had a room with a door to the adjoining room which wasn't very soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable stay”
Reviews.Author: StickyZap
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Tremont in Chicago. Excellent location right off Michigan Avenue. Booked thru Hotwire for around $69 per night during Memorial Day weekend. The room was 1 king bed with a chair, dresser, television, desk, iron/ironing board. The room was very clean and large, and staff quite friendly and helpful. We did not have the continental breakfast, tho one was provided. Mike Ditka's Steakhouse is located off the lobby. Parking was about $49 per day. The valet took our car at the door so we didn't have to worry about parking, and someone helped us with our luggage to our room. We would definitely stay at the Tremont again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific find!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BostonAlexandra
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel reminiscent of a bygone era when hotels had woodpaneled elevators and cozy fireplaced lobbies. Perfect location ...half a block from the Hancock Tower and Michigan Ave. We spent 5 days there and were able to walk to most of the sites we were interested in seeing including Lincoln Park Zoo. The hotel graciously gave us a corner room because we were celebrating our 40th anniversary and the views were terrific. The room also had a lot of personal touches you would not find in a chain hotel with their cookie-cutter layouts and decor. We were also able to open the windows slightly and get a refreshing breeze in the evening...a big plus for us. There was a continental breakfast every morning which was sufficient to start the day, but for those who wanted a more robust breakfast there was a deli two blocks away and a Starbbucks across the street. The staff was courteous and helpful and the entire atmosphere of the hotel was one of intimacy. Would definitely recommend this hotel to those who don't need all the bells and whistles. A.B. --Belmont, MA

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Price”
Reviews.Author: madscone
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the tremont for a week in early may and couldn't have been happier with the choice. its location was unbelievable, close to everything shopping, restaurants and the cta. the hotel room was big compared to others we stayed, and the bed was massive. the bathroom was fine, very clean. the guy down at reception was fantastic, great local knowledge and very friendly. breakfast was cereal and crumpets type thing, coffee too, grand to get you started. slight street noise and no curtains the only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Frindly Staff”
Reviews.Author: joexmas
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting this hotel to be as nice as it was, given the great rates they were offering. It's an older hotel with tons of charm in the lobby and the dining area. The rooms were a little small but clean. A continental breakfast, included in the price, was nothing fancy but it was a good way to start the day with coffee, juice, cereal, bagels and sweet bread. The staff was super friendly. The best things about this hotel were the price and the fantastic location. It's about fifty steps from Michigan Ave. and within walking distance from so many attractions. I took my wife and 9 month old girl and my Mom for a long Mother's day weekend. Chicago is a great town and this hotel is a great place to stay. I would stay again for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BeezusAlberta_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and have nothing but good things to stay. There's a great restaurant attached to the hotel and other eating places only two blocks away, including a 24 hour diner. The rooms were clean and compact and the hotel was very quiet. For us, the best part was the location, just half a block away from the north end of the Magnificent Mile. We like to walk, so if you don't mind walking 10-12 blocks, you can get to the downtown and theatre district. We didn't know about this beforehand, but if you go to the Chicago Cultural Centre (across from Millenium Park) you can arrange for walking tour with a local guide. Our guide, Lance, was fantastic and we have recommended him to other people travelling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: fairylova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights after booking this hotel on priceline. The location can not be beaten. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the El train and just steps from Michigan Avenue shopping. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Free breakfast was included with our stay. It wasn't much, but it was a good start to the day. My room was spacious and clean. The only down sides were that all rooms only have a single bed and there were no rollaways. Also, the shower didn't really provide much hot water despite the fact the sink had the potential to scald.

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel, The Tremont”
Reviews.Author: debbill72
Reviews.Content: Peeling paint, water damage, window would'nt close all the way with houling winds outside, one elevator for all to use, loud knocking noise all night from elevator shaft 1 room over.Location was great off of Michigan Av by water tower place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SugarBunny9
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no room service, bear in mind that. Not even hot water supply when you request for it, hence you can forget about coffee or tea in your hotel room, or even for convenient foods (Asian style) which require hot water. For families with babies, I guess you can count Tremont out. Reception had a lady which was rather unfriendly, not outright rude, but seemed bored to be at her job. Oh, bring your own umbrellas as Chicago pours quite frequently. Tremont does not provide umbrellas and would rather see you soak while searching to buy one. All furnishing in this hotel is OLD, really really old. Even bathroom adornments are seriously outdated. The bed is disappointing, pillows are worn out, and they even used safety pins to fasten the pillow covers together. Beware, you do not wish to poke your eye out now. TV basically offers only 5 channels, nothing to watch if you stay indoors. No kettle, no mini bar, no nothing in this hotel, it is as basic as you can get. They do provide hair dryers and safe boxes though. The only good thing about Tremont is that it is located just round the corner from Borders and Water Tower Place. However, if you are hoping that food will be at your convenience at Tremont, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: mmareck
Reviews.Content: Room (12th floor) wasn't huge but perfectly OK. There were no curtains but adjustable blinds, which made the room more spacious. Location is a major plus and the price resulted in very good value for money. WiFi didn't reach the 12th floor but was available (free) in the lobby area. The Tremont should appeal mainly to the individual/leisure traveller who dislikes large (chain) hotels. Business travellers might miss an in-room Internet connection and the lack of room service. The attached restaurant is fine but the evening I arrived (late) it was full and all I wanted was a quick bite to eat without having to find a restaurant. [single traveller, London UK]

Reviews.Title: “Suited us to a T”
Reviews.Author: bissyissy
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised after reading negative reviews. Our room on 12th floor was fairly spacious, clean and neat. We were in Chicago for a seven-night (shopping and eating!) break so were hardly in our room. Had done some last minute shopping before check-out and found that access to our room had been deactivated while we were out! No other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms whithout curtains!!!”
Reviews.Author: marinadalverme
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the desk gave us a small 5th floor room directly out of elevator, above air conditioned compressors running night and day, and whithout window curtains!!!!!! My wife and I didn't sleep the first night for noise and light!!!!. The day after we asked for a new room and a bored woman, finally, gave us a new room on the same floor, but in a other hotel side. In twice rooms no fast internet end only few tv channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: rintu76
Reviews.Content: Got a Priceline rate of $130. Like other users was a bit apprehensive considering some of the negative reviews. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find that our room was clean and reasonably spacious. Not too much choice in TV channels and the accommodations where very basic but we are not the type to spend a great deal of time in our room. I loved the location very close to shopping and restaurants. My only compliant was the oppressive scent of potpourri or incense in the lobby as I am very sensitive to certain scents and it caused my allergies to act up for my whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “ONE star MAYBE”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: I need to contact Hotwire as this is NOT a 3 star hotel. NO hot water, old, small dingy rooms. STAY away!

Reviews.Title: “A great value.”
Reviews.Author: nestor30
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were very happy with the accomodations. Much better than when we were here five years ago. This time we had a remodeled corner room on the 12th floor with 3 windows and a view. The staff was efficient and treated us great. We would definitely return for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and Quacker Factory details!”
Reviews.Author: Michele_Pope
Reviews.Content: For the love of God, whatever you do, DO NOT take room 307. Suffice it to say that I would rather set my hair on fire than spend two minutes in that room. Shudder! After asking for another room, was pleased with what I got. The decor is a bit "Quacker Factory-ish" ala dried floral wreath, plaid pillow shams and lace table doilies. but overall, the room was clean, the bed comfy and the housekeeper..the nicest person I have ever met in a hotel!! The hotel is a bit older but you cannot beat the location. Enjoy the room for what it is, a place to sleep whilst in Chicago. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Tremont:Good Value, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: chisox08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Tremont the nights of July 21 and July 22, 2008. The hotel had mixed reviews but I liked the location&price so\I followed through with my reservation. Although the hotel is not the most modern, it is surely functional. The elevator was out of order for a short time after I arrived but the service elevator worked just fine. I was informed that the satellite was not in service so only local channels were usable. In my case, that was not a problem but with children it might have been tough. I had a room on the 12th floor with a view of Lake Michigan and Michigan Avenue as well. The room was large enough for two if need be and clean and concise. I enjoyed the old-fashioned tub and enjoyed soaking in it on two occasions. I would reccomend The Tremont to budget conscious travelers (I paid $143 a night plus taxes)and folks that want to be near Michigan Ave. The subway is a 5 minute walk and many fine restaurants are 5 minutes or less away. The front desk crew was accomodating if not particularly friendly but who cares.

Reviews.Title: “I Liked It”
Reviews.Author: Snit93
Reviews.Content: I named my price on priceline and ended up at the Tremont. After reading all the reviews here I was really nervous about staying there, but I found it very pleasant. The staff was very friendly for the most part. There was a desk lady when we checked in who was helpful, but not overly friendly. Everyone else was very nice. It was fine for us as we were vacationing and not spending a lot of time in the hotel. We basically were there to sleep and shower and on one day nap. If we had to spend a lot of time there I wouldn't have cared for it as much since there was no cable in our room and we only got a few fuzzy channels. I did hear the desk lady tell other guests though that if the sattelite in their room isn't working they can call the front desk and watch movies and they'll take it off the bill. I was travelling with two small children and they were very nice to the kids as well. I'm going to not recommend it for people travelling with small children only because there is no pool and basically no tv, even though it was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Try something else”
Reviews.Author: PabloARG
Reviews.Content: We decided to try Hotwire for the first time, and were not so lucky. The hotel is ideally located (close to the Hancock Center, the Magnifficent Mile, Sofitel Tower, Hyatt, etc), so location is the best thing about this hotel. A+ for this. As for the hotel per se, when you arrive someone opens you the door (so you get surprised because you have read all these reviews) but that's all that is. Check in lady makes you feel you are not welcomed. She tries hard to let you know she does not want to be there. Then, there is the elevator... ha ha... exactly like the Tower of Terror in DisneyWorld. In fact, it is a wooden cart, with crancky noises and the wire hitting the walls of the elevator, what makes you think: Who (or what) is out there? Anyway... The room was in urgent need of a remodelation.... in 1970. Nowadays, everything is outdated. The AC control was so scarry we did not even try it. It had push buttons.. had never seen this. The shower had a temperature display, which looked like the oddometer of a 1940's Mercedes Benz. The door let in so much light through the borders, it looked like an allien was on the other side (if this were a movie). In fact... it all looked just as if you where taken to the Island in the series LOST, and this hotel were part of the Dharma Initiative. The hotel had complementary internet on the lobby, but as we were staying on the 7th floor, we did not get any signal. While in Chicago, you CANNOT miss the Bobby Bike Hike. It's worth every penny. The best thing we did in Chicago. We also went to Wrigley Field (was too cold and boring to enjoy), and the Hancock Center, which is also worth enjoying while having a drink (it's also pretty cheap) if you cannot afford to have dinner there. The stay was not terrible, but would deffinetely try looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cozy in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KaraokeDiva
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for one night in September 2007 and liked it very much. We got a great deal at $150 booking through lastminutetravel.com (ironically booked over two months ahead of time), amazingly cheap for a Saturday in that area. Especially considering that every other travel site I checked was charging a minimum of $220 for the Tremont on the same night -- and every other hotel in a two mile radius was averaging nearly $250 to $300. But I digress. I have to say I'm a little baffled by some of the other reviews, as we had a really nice stay at the Tremont. The location was PERFECTION less than a block from Michigan Ave, and we actually had a really neat view of the Hancock Building from our window. Additionally, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was plenty big enough for our needs, and the staff acceptably accomodating. And while the room was a bit on the small side, it's pretty much exactly what I was expecting based on everything I'd read about the Tremont. It's kind of irritating reading reviews complaining about the room size when the hotel is hardly trying to hide the fact that the rooms are not large. It IS an old, boutique hotel - if you're looking for a larger room, and willing to spend more money, then by all means go stay at the Marriott down the road. We did not spend a whole lot of time in our room, so I can't comment on things like whether or not there was cable TV (we did watch some TV, though not much -- but I could have sworn there WAS cable, but maybe we were just watching network TV before bed) or internet access, but what time we did spend was very nice, and it was a great central "home base" for coming back to between activities. I don't know that I'd recommend extended stays here, but it's fantastic for a quick weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: miasusieq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tremont with my husband, who was attending a conference in Chicago. Our room was tiny, the bed was a Queen size (expected a King for the room price), the television had only three channels that weren't too fuzzy to watch, there was no fitness center, the doorman was rude, there was a $3.00 charge per bag to store the luggage after check-out, our room always smelled musty, the bathroom flooring was in terrible shape (broken tiles with dirt in the hole where the tile piece was missing), the staff at the front desk was also rude, there is no coffee/tea maker in the room, there is also no wifi in the rooms. The cost of the room (almost $200/night) was astronomical for the lack of amenities and poor condition of the room. I have stayed at approximately 10 other hotels in Chicago (The Drake, Palmer House, Hilton on lower Michigan, Hard Rock Hotel, Hyatt on the River, and the Holiday Inn to name a few) and the Tremont is, by far, the worst hotel of the ones that I've stayed at in Chicago. A Hampton Inn located by an Interstate exit is far superior to the Tremont. Prior to our stay, I thought that "boutique hotel" meant fewer rooms, cute and quaint. Now I know that it means "sub-standard accomodation". I will certainly never stay at the Tremont again.

Reviews.Title: “Leave the Tremont”
Reviews.Author: AndrewLNewYork
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. There is no cable tv and the front desk does not tell you. As a matter of fact, they are rude and don't care that you are upset, tired, and generally not in the mood for an idiot front desk person to give you attitude. The rooms are dingy and generally, this hotel is closing in on the fleebag category of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, but beware: No high-speed Internet in rooms”
Reviews.Author: moonflower68
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Tremont for 2 nights ($100/night via Priceline). After reading so many complaints on Tripadvisor, I wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. My room was perfectly comfortable, not at all decrepit or crumbling as some other travelers have complained. I did ask for a "newer room, if possible" when I checked in, and that might have gotten me a nicer room. Fabulous location just off Michigan Ave. Room was reasonable in size and quiet. Bathroom was unexpectedly spacious, with ample counter space (marble). Not spanking new but cerrtainly nice enough. Everything was clean. The A/C worked fine. I found the staff to be courteous and helpful. No complaints there at all. Yes, the elevator is slow, but not a big deal. Two inconveniences of note: 1) No high-speed Internet offered in the rooms (though I was able to access it one way - read on). This is the main reason I can't give the Tremont a higher rating. Because of this, the hotel may be unacceptable to many business travelers. There IS wifi in the lobby, as well as at the Starbucks across the street. Numerous business travelers (including myself) did set themselves up in the cozy lobby to use the wifi. Oddly, after I had accessed the hotel's wireless network in the lobby and then returned to my room, I was able to connect to the network from my room -- continuously, with a strong signal -- for the rest of my stay (~36 hours), whereas I couldn't before. 2) In my room, there were no accessible electric outlets next to the bed, so the phone and clock radio had to be placed on the desk (out of reach) rather than on either nightstand. In sum, I found the Tremont to be a decent, wonderfully located boutique hotel that needs a bit of updating (i.e., Internet) but is in all other ways quite comfortable. I will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If I had paid full price, I would have been pissed.”
Reviews.Author: imaaveragejoe
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews and found them helpful. This hotel is not worth what they are charging for a room and I don't care about the area it is in. If you want to stay here, you need to get a deal and probably stay only one night. We aren't hotel snobs, we don't expect to be treated as if we are on a State visit. The location is truely remarkable but the room we had on the ninth floor was clean, needed some updating, had no a/c but a great breeze coming through windows that had no screen and opened fully, Got small kids who like to climb...beware! Normally, Chicago in April is cool but with no a/c, had it been July....forget about it. The elevator is not that scarey, I've been in worse. Having Ditka's restaurant off the lobby was really nice. The staff was friendly enough and we were in just for an overnight and found that it met our needs. The lobby was stuffy but well appointed. But, if I had paid full price, I would be pissed.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SeashellerIllinois
Reviews.Content: We'd always heard such good things about the Tremont, so booked an overnight getaway. We often choose smaller "boutique" type hotels rather than larger, glitzier lodging. To say we were terribly disappointed would be an understatement. We had booked a "deluxe room" which the reservations operator highly recommended. She said, "You will be VERY pleased with this room." The desk clerk was rather curt, and when we got up to the room, we couldn't believe it. For close to $300 it was a small, dark space. The thin white METAL blinds on the smallish windows were all broken and crooked. The door paint was all chipped. The bathroom was a joke. We'd been told it was an "all-marble" bath. The tile was all chipped, and the tiny vanity cabinet which looked like something from the 60's had no knobs (missing) and looked like it had been painted over a dozen times. There was hardly any room to walk around the king bed. The fabrics on the bedding and drapes and the carpeting were tired and looked faded. The room had an oddly-angled wall and on it was stuck a battered TV cabinet that didn't fit. It was pathetic. We decided not to stay, and it took about 20 minutes for the doorman to locate our car. Needless to say, we'll not be returning to the Tremont, even though it has a great location just off Michigan Av. near Watertower Place. In this case, location isn't everything.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: UKJamesB
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was mentioned in my guidebook as one the oldest hotels in Chicago. Well, I can believe it. The decor was faded at best and chips and cracks were evident everywhere (although the lounge area off the lobby was pleasant). The staff - apart from the doorman - were not particularly friendly and I certainly did not feel very welcome. My main gripe is that while there are no minibars in the rooms there is also no room service. I was told quite matter of factly that if I wished to eat - I had to leave my room for the Mike Ditka's steakhouse attached to the hotel. The restaurant is fair but far from economical. I do believe that a city hotel should offer small snacks or at least provide a refigerator to purchase one's own. To make matters worse my shower/bath control froze on high heat and I was forced to wrap my hand in a towel and plunge my hand into the bath to release the plug in order to prevent flooding. It could not be repaired and I was moved to a smaller room that was less well situated. No compensation was offered. On the plus side the maintenance man was pleasant and helpful - even if the other staff were not. Unfortunately he didn't have the power to obtain an equal or better room for me. All in all - the Tremont lets down its own history as well as the great city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingerica
Reviews.Content: Purchased room through Priceline, so was unsure what it would be liked, we loved it. You could see the John Hancock building from the front door. Great location. Right across the street was a Starbucks and the whole street was really well lit. It is older and there is some wear but the rooms were nicely decorated. They smelled wonderful! There was definitly character. Would recommed! They let us store our baggage after check out till we were ready to catch the train home.

Reviews.Title: “A charming old hotel for couples in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: JenniInOz
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that I read hundreds of reviews and had decided NOT to stay at the Tremont Hotel before visiting Priceline for our 10-year anniversary trip to Chicago. However, since Priceline had the Tremont listed as a 3-star, we were "stuck" with it. At $130 a night for two nights, I was a little peeved, but I told my husband to go into this with an open mind, to expect the worst and hope for the best. We were prepared for a miserable experience, but we were so pleasantly surprised! We arrived over 5 hours before check-in time expecting to ask them if they could hold our luggage until later but our room was already available. We took the elevator up to the 7th floor and entered our beautifully decorated but smallish room. We like a cooler room so immediately turned the thermostat to cool and went to check out the view. We had two windows. The first one we looked out had a rooftop/alley view, so imagine our surprise when we looked out the other window directly at the Hancock Building less than a block away!! There was also a view of a beautiful Catholic church, a corner of Michigan Ave. and even the lake off in the distance. Our cable worked fine including HBO, despite the reviews. The bathroom was also very nice. We set out to see the sights and when we returned the room was even hotter than before. Apparently they completely shut off the air to the hotel during winter months. So we opened the window and took a little catnap. I should mention that the room is VERY quiet with the window closed and not too bad with it open if you don't mind a little city noise. HOWEVER, at 6:00 Friday night we were promptly awakened by that beautiful church's 15-minute long bell chimes! It wasn't terribly loud, but it was enough to get us up from a nap! The hotel does not have room service which they made plain upon our arrival but there are so many restaurants within walking distance, including Ditka's which is attached to the Tremont (try the pot roast nachos). There is no continental breakfast (Starbucks is across the street) or pool and fitness center, which we knew before we arrived. So the wallpaper was peeling in just a few places - the place was very clean. We greeted the housekeeper both mornings as we left. So the elevator was slow - we weren't in a hurry anyway. We loved it! It was charming and comfortable and the location is amazing! We walked two blocks to Michigan Ave. & Water Tower or took the CTA train (the "L") everywhere. The red line station is .2 miles away (about 5 blocks?). We were blessed with fantastic March weather and the fact that the St. Patrick's Day celebrations were that weekend, but all in all we truly enjoyed our stay. If you're looking for a sterile, cookie-cutter environment with lots of amenities this is not your place. It's not terribly family-friendly but we were on vacation FROM our kids anyway. A gentleman in the lobby remarked to me that the hotel reminded him of his grandmother's house, and I would completely agree with that assessment. (Incidentally, I checked Hotels.com a few days before we left and rooms at the Tremont for our weekend were going for over $230/night!)

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: ACLEM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in Chicago for St. Pat's; we stayed at the Tremont. We were very apprehensive about this hotel based on all of the bad reviews, but booked anyway because it was the best price we could find for the location we wanted. When we arrived we were pleasantly suprise. First Impression: The hotel is in a great location, less than a block off of Michigan Ave. It appears nice from the street and has doormen and valet parking just like any other higher priced hotel. Upon entering the lobby we were greated with a wonderful scent, it was a great smelling place (there were candles burning.) Also, the lobby was very comfortable, with leather sofas and a grand piano. Check In: We were nervous about check-in b/c we had read so many reviews that said the customer service was horrible. We experienced the exact opposite. The front desk attendants were all very friendly and helpful. Check-in is at 3pm and we arrived at noon and were given our room with no problems. The room: A little dated, but clean and comfortable. I did see some of the things others complained about, such as peeling wall paper and chipped paint; but, neither were were that bad or noticeable. I am a clean freak and brought my own blanket and sheets but found the one's provided to be clean and fresh. The only real problems we had with the room was that the heating system was very old and hard to use, we were constantly hot and had no way to turn any air on; and the windows were very thin and you could hear a lot of street noise. Overall, we would recommend this hotel. It has a very reasonable price tag compared to others in the same location, and was clean and comfortable. If you want a great breakfast spot walk about 4 blocks North and you will find a little restaurant called "The Pancake House", it was wonderful. Pros: Price, Location Cons: Outdated

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great mints, crappy hotel rooms & service”
Reviews.Author: sassyd02
Reviews.Content: DO NOT pay full price for this hotel. It is not worth the $110 that the Tremont will charge you. Go through Hotwire. If you want this one book with the 3 star hotel in the Gold Coast Area & you should get this hotel automatically for much cheaper! I've done it three times and got this one each time. The lobby is very quaint and cute, but the girl working behind the counter shuffled around the desk for a good 30 seconds (one mississippi- two mississippi-three mississippi) before she even greeted us. The service staff was sub par during our entire stay (they just aren't very service oriented). The rooms are quite cramped. Make sure not to accept a room next to the elevator b/c it's banging will keep you up all night even if it is sitting idle. Also, this hotel does not have two beds in any room. Only Queens or Kings so you might want to call ahead and make sure you get a King. I stay at a different Chicago hotel almost every month and this one has BY FAR the best location of them all. Right around the corner from the Water Tower Mall & right next to all the best bars on Rush St. Book this if you don't mind putting up with the things I mentioned earlier, but would like a great location. Oh yeah...they have great Lifesavers Wintergreen mints all over the lobby. Take as many as you can pocket. They were the highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and worn out”
Reviews.Author: Dennyspence
Reviews.Content: Hotel is tired and worn out. Everything is old. The bed sagged in the middle and was the most uncomfortable I have been since I last went camping and slept in a sleeping bag on the ground. I asked for an upgrade upon arrival and was told immediately no, as they were expecting a big crowd that night. I saw two people in the lobby during my entire night's stay. There is no room service. The view was nice but the only reason to stay here would be the incredible location.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent...”
Reviews.Author: Parys
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tremont. I am a regular. I must say, I think some people are a little picky. You must keep in mind, that this is a hotel that was built in the '30's (if memory serves me correctly). Rooms are not built for families and things don't always look or work like they are new. This is a good hotel for a single person or a couple. While, one could tell (and from personal experience) that about 10 years ago, this was one of the top hotels in Chicago. Now, it is just worn. I can see they are really trying to fix up what you can, but it is apparent that their parent company is not willing to pay to renovate. Nor have they in the many years I have been going. WHy do I go? Well, I must say, they have some staff that have been there as long as I have been going (Housekeeping and the doorman). They have a very dedicated management team who have always responded to my needs (Front Desk and Accounting even the GM). The prices are generally good too, you just need to understand that when everyone else in Chi is charging a lot, so are they. I suggest those who are dissatisfied don't take it out on the staff that work there, take it out on the owners, as the staff can't control the environment. Thanks again Tremont, for being home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but depends on room”
Reviews.Author: carajano
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Hotwire and it was really well priced so I knew not to expect too much but when we checked in our room was stinking of stale smoke and was on the 2nd floor right next to an unsafe fire escape. I spoke to the front desk and they were ok with us and offered us another room on the 10th floor the next day. We gladly took them up on this offer and were delighted with our new room. It was worlds apart from the first one and was really nice. The bar is really cool and has great singers. The location is AMAZING! It is just off Michigan, kind of along form the Hancock tower and really close to the Tempo Cafe for waffles! You can walk everywhere and if you request a non smoking room it is worth it just for the location on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, crummy hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyG1234
Reviews.Content: Room was a D at best. Service was a flat out F. You are lucky if someone is at the register to give you a key. I was waiting for 10 plus minutes. The doorman sleeps standing up. Terrible value for the money at Tremont. Very dated and not an ounce of charm. Too bad someone with some design and money doesn't buy this one up and do something with it. No room service. Walk downstairs to Ditka's for food (which is a B- at best). Location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Classical hotel with a great perspective”
Reviews.Author: nmw925
Reviews.Content: I stayed there just to relax myself after a busines trip at NY. I love this hotel the way this is a old historical building, with a great taste and perspective. PRICE is very reasonable (i paid less than US$100 per night). for those who enjoyed the history and tradtional classic hotel, Tremont is a good choice for you. Greatly located near North Michigan Avenue, walking distance to most major shops. I rented a car and i used the hotel's velvet parking service, the costing was reasonable and i could enjoy good service from those guys. Overall i liked this hotel and next time i would like to share my experience with my girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tigger76
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, my company paid the $350 a night cost of a room here, because I would have wanted my money back. The lobby smelled like pesticide, my room had mold on the ceiling, and the comforters were like the cheap cotton ones from Target. I can't believe that they get away with charging those prices, I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as bad as reviews.”
Reviews.Author: R_U_Serious67
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Tremont for 3 nights & I was a bit scared from some of the reviews but overall I enjoyed my stay there. It's true the rooms need some updating but I did see some work going on on my floor where a room was getting new carpet so there's hope there. Only other negative was no wireless or other high speed in the rooms so I had to go down to the lobby for this where they had wireless. Location was good, the hotel was very quiet and I found the staff to be friendly and helpful but not overbearing. There's a great pizza place 2 blocks up on State Street called Pisano's if you want some deep dish Chicago pizza and a supermarket beside that called Potash Bros. (or something). I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ewww, but a great lobby...”
Reviews.Author: twigtwig
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, let it be known that I LOVE old buildings, houses, etc. My own house was built in 1900. Reserved (hotels.com), and received confirmation of, a non-smoking, king (I am a 6' tall woman, so I nicely emphasized this while reserving, as well as while reconfirming) room. Called to inform hotel of late (9pm) arrival a few days prior (like a week at least), and was told that there wouldn't be any problem - reconfirmed room-type again at that point. Arrived to beautiful, cozy, fragrant, warm lobby, only to take elevator (yes, it's true what the others have said about the elevator - slow as molasses... but I digress, and to me that was charming) to.... a nice, architecturally-pleasing hallway, to (EEEEEEK!!) the no-tell, motel room from hell - rm 1406. The carpet was brand new, and the bathroom had been remodeled, but oh-my-gosh, wow! I actually laughed outloud while standing there when I opened the door. Threadbare polyester bedspread which appeared to a be from a Motel 6 auction. Spiders (three) visible (luckily, I'm an afraid-of-bees person, so they didn't scare/bother me), poly/cotton threadbare sheets, hard-as-a-rock mattress, pillows w/funky smells and no support, a headboard that whacked against the wall when you got within 2 feet of the bed, broken furniture, fluorescent bulbs in the lamps (to add the the ambiance, I suppose...), paint peeling off of the walls and trim, stains on the walls and ceiling, and the piece-de-resistance: one tacky, gold-lame-trimmed K-Mart (yes, I shop there, but, wow...) floral picture visibly bolted (ie: someone took a drill, and just drilled right through the front of it with 2 big screws) to the wall - PERFECT! I decided since the carpet appeared to be new, I would take my chances there with the placement of my luggage. The bed, of course, was a full or queen size (hard to say - so microscopic), so I picked up the phone to ask (nicely - it's not the front desk person's fault that a hotel sucks) the front desk if I should come downstairs to get a new room with the king bed that I reserved. I was told that "when you reserve online, there's no guarantee that you'll get a king bed." It's not like I went to one of those websites where it's a crapshoot or like I didn't reconfirm my stay and room-type. I was so tired (and since this hotel was only for one night before my hotel for the rest of my stay in Chicago was available), I thanked her and resigned myself to the fact that this was where I was going to have to sleep... to the tune of $190. I slept diagonally, with my feet poking off the end of the bed - nice. I honestly worried about bedbugs all night long, and nicely checked out at 9AM to go wait in the lobby of the hotel I was going to be staying in for the rest of my trip. For $30 more/night, I had the ultimate, old-timey hotel experience at the truly wonderful Whitehall Hotel thereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Tremont - What a great location”
Reviews.Author: CJayDJ
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Tremont was it's location. At the top of the street was Michigan Avenue - at the start - so you could walk all the way up and see all the shops. At the bottom, behind, Tremont, was another street (can't recall name) which was bustling with cafes (and a free internet cafe) and restaurants at night and near Oak St with other high end retailers. The room itself was on the small side as was the bathroom which felt a bit cramped, however, it was all clean and comfortable so no complaints really (no views to speak of, just next door's roof). The only downfall which isnt really a downfall, just a gripe of mine, was the awful potpourri at reception which wasnt to my favour at all. Otherwise, it was reasonable value for money, safe, comfortable and clean and in a safe area/street. The bus was at the top of the street (Michigan Ave) - very handy.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful people and very accommading”
Reviews.Author: littlebite
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in Chicago for a couple of nights for doctor visits and had to make reservations the night before i left. It seemed every hotel that i contacted in the area of Nothewestern University Hospital was booked due to some expo in town. The only room that was available for the first night was $468.00 and the reservationist that i spoke to(they are always in some other town for some reason,can't the hotel make the reservation when they pick up the phone?) said that the second night would only be $167.00 and no explanation as to why the drop in rates. The next morning i found out that the reason for the price drop was that i would have to move rooms. When the woman saw that i was genuinly surprised,she let us keep the room-and it was a corner suite! Now for the room and service review--- the hotel is old and it is clean. I stayed at the newish Wyndham and saw unfortunate spots on the floor in more than one area! At this place i didn't notice anything that would make me go, "eeeww" The water pressure was awsome and the bathrooms were very clean(we had two baths) Yes the elevator was slow and one time we slipped up the service lift-big deal. The elevator is shaky and small and it worked just fine. I'm more frightened of rush hour traffic. The last day of our stay i asked the desk clerk the best way to get to the hospital parking lot and she said that i could park there till 6pm and still be checked out. She said to just have the valet load our vehicle with our bags and forget it. Wow! She saved me time driving in Chicago traffic and the extra expence of parking. I would have liked curtains on the windows to block out the morning sun-there were just mini blinds. And i think there should have been two night stands especially for a king size bed. Wonderful service and i will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff08
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat. The hotel is right near the Water Tower shopping mall and within close walking distance to the red line and bus stops. Although the hotel is older (1920s), the 'grossness' factor is very very low. The water pressure is amazing, towels fluffy and big, and linens comfortable. The staff were very friendly and always available to answer any questions we had. Don't expect the Ritz Carlton and you will be pleasantly surprised. Definitely book this hotel if you are on a budget, but want a fabulous location and clean accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Deal”
Reviews.Author: ottos
Reviews.Content: Cannot confirm those reviews below average. Having got a room for 150 $ at a weekend in August at bedfinder.com was an extremely reasonable deal for this hotel situated near Hancock Tower/Michigan Avenue. Sure the last renovation is years ago, but I got a room which was spacious enough and everything was clean. The reception could have been more friendly - but I really didn't care cause it was extremely difficult to find a downtown room at all for 2 nights....

Reviews.Title: “Basic, overpriced but great location”
Reviews.Author: tomdickanarry
Reviews.Content: Location aside this hotel is poor. There is something of an effort to ensure cleanliness, but a carpet that is overly worn will never look good whether clean or not. Same applies to paintwork, fixtures and fittings. Reports elsewhere of staff surliness were not encountered but we did 'enjoy' some fun and games with the lift not working. Nonetheless, the service lift was always available. Our room had a non opaque glass window in the bathroom, directly facing the loo which was somewhat disconcerting given the lack of a window blind. Ditka's is adjoined (almost as if the two establishments are under the same ownership)....and is still a top notch steak house. If you're on a budget and you simply want to be in just about the best location in town, then this place can be value for money if you manage to get a reasonable priceline or hotwire deal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor attendance, misleading information, poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: nextcentury
Reviews.Content: Although the Tremont Hotel was highly recommended for its great location and charm, only the first one applies. It would be charming if the owners would apply some maintenance to it. If you read the hotel website, there are a lot of ammenities listed, which you will not find in the room. Although there is a small note at the page bottom which reads, not all of the ammenities apply to all the rooms, one would not expect not to have at least a fridge in the room. When I asked for that, I was told only the suites rooms next door had a fridge and would cost around US$ 100, more, which is absurd. Nothing was mentioned when making a reservation. The counter personnal were not friendly, nor helpful, not even attentive, we had a delayed baggage and it was delivered at the hotel the same day we arrived, but even after asking for it many times, the staff would say it had not arrived, only after I had called the airline company many times, they assured me it was at the hotel, so only after I asked to see the hotel office that I saw it was there lying right at the side of the person who said it had not arrived. At the end of the stay we were charged about US$ 20, for a non placed call. It was enough! Only the beauty and friendliness of Chicago made up for so many nuisances.

Reviews.Title: “Old but good”
Reviews.Author: Eugenius
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the earlier reviews I arrived at the Tremont filled with trepidation.The Hotel is situated just opposite the Water Tower Shopping Mall on Michigan Ave and is an excellent location.Yes there was an old elevator but it worked perfectly fine and | have often waited longer in some modern hotels with banks of elevators.The room I had was old fashioned in terms of its style(too much brown for my personal taste) but it was clean and had a comfy double bed.The air con worked fine and the Bathroom was clean and towels were changed twice per day.The staff were extremely obliging in ringing restaurants to change or amend reservations and Mike Ditka's next door is not only an excellent steakhouse but we used the bar as our base before heading out each night Over all I have no hesitation in recommending The Tremont for an excellent value for money hotel with location,location,location

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, affordable, needs a bit of updating”
Reviews.Author: Maiel
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, there was quite a qeue because there was only 1 male person in the front desk and about 5 guests were waiting for their turn to check in. It took about 15 minutes before we got our turn. Once we hopped onto the elevator, there was a weird sound, which we believe was the cable responsible for its motion. The elevator was really small and could only accommodate about 4pax. If you were like us with big luggages, then about 2pax could only fit in. Our room was comfortable. We were on the 7th floor and it was clean, simple and decent. We would have appreciated a complimentary bottle of water though, given that we came from a very long trip. The valet and bellhop were very friendly. I just wish that the guy in the front desk were just as friendly and helpful. He seemed very busy but you know, a smile and warm greeting every now and then wouldnt hurt. Just a few meters from the Michigan mile, this hotel is perfect for those who love shopping. Across is a starbucks shop, so, if you like coffee, it's very convenient. Check out was a breeze. It was done by the lady receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for the Price”
Reviews.Author: swensley
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, my husband and I were very wary of staying at The Tremont. However, once we arrived we were very happy with our accomodations. For under $90 a night thru Priceline, we thought the hotel was a great value. Our room was nice, but did show some wear. However, for $40 we could have chosen to upgrade, which we declined. It is in a superb location, very near public transportation and points of interest. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremont Chicago - very average and needing updates!”
Reviews.Author: foxyroxyfu
Reviews.Content: While the Tremont is in an excellent location, the hotel needs updating. It's the most affordable hotel in the area but a little paint, etc. could go a long way. The staff and lobby were nice, but our room had excessively chipped wood work, hardware falling off of furniture, frayed carpet, stained carpet, stained marble, mold in the tub, dirt in the overhead lamp and the wallpaper was peeling off in the bathtub. It was not entirely filthy, but I would have preferred spending $30-$50 more a night somewhere else that was perhaps cleaner. In my opinion its very average, but if you are looking for something cheap this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some have posted”
Reviews.Author: checo446
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Tremont as I was taking a class in Chicago. I booked it on Hotwire for 85.00/night which was the cheapest rate I could find for staying there the week I went. The hotel is old and has signs of wear in the rooms such as peeling wall paper and a door that stuck when I opened it, but I actually enjoyed my stay due to the neighborhood I was in and how close it was to everything. I will go through the positives: LOCATION, LOCATION LOCATION- you are literally less than 1 block from the John Hancock Center off the shopping on Michigan Avenue. You also have great access to public transit as you are a 3 minute walk to the Red Line L station and various buses off Michigan Avenue (I didn't rent a car for the week I stayed there and was able to get just about everywhere I wanted to. Functional Room-The room's A/C worked and kept my room cool on one of the hotter days I stayed there. The water was hot when I took showers. The room had a desk which helped me get some work done and studying. Cable TV was available however the stations were somewhat limited. The bed was comfortable and closet was functional. Room View: I had a great view of the Hancock Center out of my room's window. Ask for one of the rooms that end with a 4. My room was 1104 and it was pretty nice as I could see the sun rising and reflecting on all the buildings to the east. The staff I dealt with was friendly and helped me with directions when I needed them. now to the Negatives: No high speed internet access in the rooms. They do however have internet access in the hotel's lobby. The elevator creeks and is very slow. There is wear in the hotel's rooms due to the hotel's age. In my room is was mainly cosmetic, ie. wallpaper peeling. Overall, if you are looking for the Ritz I would recommend this hotel, but if you are looking for a place to sleep and can get the rooms for a decent price, I think you will be satisfied with your stay as you are directly located in the heart of the vibrant Michigan Avenue area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to stay in an old dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenaben
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful! I would suggest not taking the pictures that you see on the websites too seriously...the photos of this hotel had to be taken at least 20 years ago. I love old buildings and architecture, but this was a little extreme. I felt like I was going to die every time I rode the elevator (it shook like crazy and rubbed up against the side of the elevator shaft the whole ride), the toilet and sink to wash your hands were in two different rooms, AND the folks at the front desk were everything except friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,but thats the only good thing.”
Reviews.Author: gllama78
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. We were on the third floor with a view of the alley. This made waking up horrible cause the trash men were collecting trash at 6am and even thou the windows were closed we were awakened. The wall paper was peeling, the lighting in the bathroom was horrible. Oh and if you want to stay and shop after you check out, they'll charge you so much to hang on to your bags. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a bit old school”
Reviews.Author: martafoos
Reviews.Content: When visitng chicago there is no better area to be in than right outside the john hancock building. steps away from the nightlife and the Mag mile (Shopping) plus access to the transit system and all the glory of the navy pier from the worlds fair. This hotel was by all of those things. the only problems were the price.. 160 with AAA. Our room was extremely small and a painting was missing off the wall to reveal years of yellowing beneath. Terribly tiny elevators which made you a bit shaky. The woodwork downstairs is very nice, but no main area to really sit and converse. just a small hallway with a checkin service( normally only one person) to give a perfect discription of the hotel rooms themselves. It felt like a hitman from the 1940's was gonna come in. Very old school if you know what i mean. Like i was a mobster doing soemthing illegal. If you are a person who looks for new furnishings and extremelyt clean and spacious rooms.. Stay away... if your someone who wants to capture the way hotels used to be then feel free to stay. also there was a very nice 24 hour restaurant right outside called il tempo.. very good. decent pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not as bad as previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: deparker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 30-April 1. I have stayed here a couple other times because the location is fantastic (near all the Michigan Ave shopping and restaraunts). Never thought the hotel was luxury but never really had problems either. Room was clean and front staff was friendly during this stay. Windows could use a little more soundproofing. I got the rate for this hotel on Hotwire for $56.00 a night!! Great price for this location (safe area too)! Honestly, I've never had many problems here and would stay here again for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with charm”
Reviews.Author: operagirl1970
Reviews.Content: The Tremont turned out to be our winning bid on a discount travel site, and for the $77 per night that we paid St. Patrick's Day weekend, it was definitely worth it. The location is amazing, half a block from Michigan Avenue and the Hancock Center. Water Tower is just another block down. There is a Starbuck's directly across the street and a great Italian deli called L'Appetito in the sublevel of the John Hancock building as well as a Cheesecake Factory. I was a little wary going in based on some reviews I read on this site previously, but we were completely satisfied with our room. The room was clean and nicely decorated, and the bathroom was decent-sized. The front desk staff was friendly, and when we needed new pillows for our bed late at night (my husband is allergic to the goose down that was there), they brought some up within 10 minutes. The only negative was our ability to hear noise from the next room through the walls, but if you have quieter neighbors, it isn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially for the price. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: brunoj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont Hotel in March 2007 for 3 days. We stayed in room 1507 on the 15th floor, which is a corner room and pretty spacious. The location is great. The hotel is 500 ft. from Michigan avenue, very close to the Water Tower. Around the corner to the South is Argo Tea and there is a Starbucks right across the street. The hotel staff was very friendly, we had no problems with them. The room was a little loud at night (including construction noise and street musicians). We think the windows are not very well insulated (noise and water condensation in the morning). Also the heater made noise at night. We should have just turned it off, but were too tired to be thinking clearly. The room was clean although the bathroom had a small amount of mold in the corners of the shower and under some peeling wallpaper. There were some other small cosmetic problems, but not enough the detract from the boutique feel.

Reviews.Title: “UHgGG!!! DONT GO!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: evo614
Reviews.Content: After being told to go to The Tremont for its great price and location, we regretably found that those were its only good qualities. We arrived with no valet attending the stand, and no greeter at the door, so we had to wait out in the below freezing temperatures for someone to arrive. Once we walked in, the smell overpowered us and we could only conclude that it was an old lady rotting on the sofa, waiting for her room. The slow elevator screeched and rocked us up to our room, where we fell to our knees and thanked the lord that we made it to our floor. But once we opened the door to our room, we were not so thankful anymore. The pungent smell of mold mixed with throw-up and rotting beer was so overwhelming that we had to immediately leave the room until a later time of a more incoherance. Like the other reviewer, we found out about the spattering waterhead and the flood of water well above our ankles. We felt as if we were cleaner before we attempted to shower in this place. I was looking for the hair dryer, when i tired to open the cabinet of the vanity and it fell off in my hands to reveal TWO empty old beer cans and other garbage amongst inches of dust and filth. After awakening the next morning, and even though it was only 7:00 am and -19 degrees outside, we could not stand this place any longer and immediately got dressed and left. well... i should say 'tried" to leave, the valet took 20 minutes to get our car when we were told no more than 10 minutes and obviously the only customers waiting. P.S.- Don't ask the front desk for any help, with a glare and a roll of the eyes - you will be denied!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: thriftytracy
Reviews.Content: When determining if you want to stay at this hotel, ask yourself WHY you are in Chicago. Are you in Chicago to spend most of your day out shopping, or are you there to enjoy staying in the hotel? If you want a really nice hotel and plan on spending a lot of time there, then this isn't the hotel for you. Yes, it's older and it does have some cosmetic issues. BUT, the location is awesome! Across the street is the Westin and I giggled to myself knowing what they paid for their POSH hotel, and what I paid for my average hotel. We probably have an equal amount of steps to Michigan Avenue, so location is mute. I personally go to Chicago to shop and eat out. I really don't care much about the quality of linens or the speed of the elevator. I want convenience for a low price. This is it!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but skip it!”
Reviews.Author: LittleArchie
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last moment on Super Bowl Sunday planning to do some shopping on Monday. The price was good and it had a 3 star rating on the service we used. Bad Choice! The carpet in the room was filthy. There was mold on walls of the bath. We found bloodstains on the bed spread. Wallpaper was peeling. Towels were few and tiny. The water in the sink was barely above a drip and the hot never got even warm after letting it run for 20 minutes. The bathtub drain was s-l-o-w. Worst of all was the heat (lack of). This was a very cold weekend. The heater in the room had it's outlet in the ceiling above the entryway, and the return air intake was between it and the door. As a result, the heat circulated up and down by the door and failed to warm the rest of the room. We nearly froze. There was a quarter inch of frost on the inside of the windows in the morning. We had booked two nights. Naturally, we did not stay the second night. We have contacted Hotels.com about a refund for the unused second night, but have been unable to get a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisApril
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, no one helped us with the door or offered to take our luggage. The first thing I noticed as I entered the hotel was the awful smell of old potpourri. After we checked in, we waited for the one and only elevatorâ€¦ talk about slow! Once we got to our room, it just kept getting worse. There were black streaks on the wall above the vent in the room as if smoke had come out of the vent at one time. But I suppose that was better than the mold growing around the ceiling vent in the bathroom. I went to close the drain in the bathroom sink and the drain pull came completely out of the sink. Although, thatâ€™s better than the shower drain which wasnâ€™t draining at all. By the end of my shower, I had water up to my ankles. The only good thing about this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousWI
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and won a room at the Tremont for $50.00/night. I was very apprehensive after reading the reviews here. Really, there is nothing to worry about, and I consider myself picky about such things. Yes, the room was small and the windows need cleaning, but we weren't in Chicago to hang out in a hotel room or gaze out the window. The location was great, we walked everywhere we went. The Tremont lobby is cozy and inviting (and smells awesome). The staff was nothing but kind. Our room was decorated nicely and they don't bolt the fixtures down to the walls or the furniture like they expect common theives to be staying with them. The bed had huge pillows and a pretty duvet. People have complained about the elevator, but we thought it was great, it's old and it's slow and it makes noise, but big deal, it is a throwback in time and part of the experience. We thought the hotel reminded us of what The Hollywood Hotel at Disney would have looked like back in it's prime. Bottom line, if a crack in the ceiling and non-perfect wallpaper are going to ruin your vacation, don't go here, if you want a cute room in a great location, book it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: Faith91
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tremont 23 years ago and back then it was amazing. I remember having room service bring croissants and tea and everything was perfect. Fast forward to 2007... It is still a nice hotel, but compares to an aging film star. The rooms need some attention. There were cracks in the ceiling, wallpaper that was peeling, molding that was missing, paint that was chipped. The bedspread was old and very worn. The bed was not comfortable. The overall look of the room was nice...beautiful curtains, nice lamps, the bathroom was nice size and clean. If you own a hotel, details should be important. Cosmetic changes are not hard to take care of!! I run a weekly condo rental and I am so picky that nobody would ever give us a negative review. It just depends on the standard of excellence of the owners. We either strive for excellence in our lives, or we don't. The Tremont Hotel is located within a minute's walk of all the stores. Amazing location. We found parking out in front in the evening so we didn't have to pay to park. Ditka's Retaurant looked wonderful and we should have eaten there but ate at another place and I ended up sick and had to leave Chicago early, missing our conference. Would I stay at the Tremont again? Maybe...I only paid $99 so if i was watching my money, I would stay again. But I think next time I will try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: Tomaszewski
Reviews.Content: We thought that the Hotel was fine for a small boutique facility that was clean, nicely appointed and had a friendly staff. Very quaint. It doesn't have a bank of high speed elevators like the larger surrounding facilities but you could converse with the staff without having to wait in line for 20 minutes. Free morning coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. It is conveniently located off Michigan Avenue across from Water Tower Place and is attached to Ditka's Restaurant(the reason for the faint smell of cigar smoke). A great facility for couples wanting to experience downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay...As always!”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJeff
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to read some of the negative reviews here! I've stayed here for years and have never had a bad room or experience. Granted, some of the rooms are small, and they lack the "bling" of the newer (and new money) hangouts, but part of the charm of the Tremont is it's old English style. I highly recommend it, but then, I'm not a "chain hotel" person. I appreciate the quiet, discreet charm of the Tremont.

Reviews.Title: “treemont hotel”
Reviews.Author: don1954
Reviews.Content: Istayed at the treemont hotel in chicago in october 06 i stayed in room 1507 the room was very clean and nice and all the staff were very nice and helpful i look forward to staying there again i had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Such Great Service”
Reviews.Author: purpletang465
Reviews.Content: I was in downtown Chicago for my b-day and we booked a room at the Tremont Hotel. We stayed in room 1507. The staff was outstanding the room and the service was beautiful. The colors and the decor was great. It was such a warm cozy room after a nice night out. Everyone was courteous, friendly, smilng....It was such a great night. I would make it my hotel of choice anytime I am in the downtown area for anything. Just for the friendliness and the way I was treated during my stay. I rate the hotel a 10. Have a great day .....

Reviews.Title: “Flee! Flee! Flee!”
Reviews.Author: BongoDrums
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible, horrible hotel in a great location! It was dirty, old, and worn. The carpet was threadbare, the wallpaper was peeling, the paint came off the ceiling in chunks, there was mold on the bathroom ceiling and walls, and the fridge and faucet did NOT work. The only elevator is tiny! Most disappointing, it is run by small-minded people without a clue how to solve a problem or earn customer loyalty. We asked to change rooms, and were told with a sigh that they're all like that...Sounds harsh, I know, but this was a disastrous experience, redeemed only by the amazing service at the hotel we fled to! Climbing the management chain was unfruitful...They had our money, and they were satisfied with that. Our satisfaction was ENTIRELY disregarded and irrelavent. FLEE!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: MMCM
Reviews.Content: This place is just disgusting. It was insanely priced for what you get. The hotel was like an absolute sauna. The room is VERY old and worn, and we stayed in one of the "nicer" suites. And for our money, we got a beautiful view of a construction site. The bathroom lineoleum was worn completely down to the wood, the wallpaper was peeling off everywhere, and I had to use a washcloth to turn the shower off and on and flush the toilet so I wouldn't have to touch anything. That reminds me, you have to sit sideways on the toilet to take care of business because the toilet is so slammed against the wall. The only good thing about the hotel was Mike Ditka's restaurant (since there isn't any room service). The food there is incredible and the portions are more than generous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel & location!”
Reviews.Author: movie
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I surprised my grand-daughter for her birthday with a trip to Chicago & The American Doll Place. I read some bad reviews about the Tremont Hotel & was very nervous about our stay. The shuttle let us off in front of the charming 1928 building & the Bell-Man greeted us with a friendly smile and helped with our luggage. As we walked into the lobby we smelled the best candle we have ever smelled. Our room was available for an early check in and it was very nice & clean and much bigger than I expected- My daughter had stayed at the hotel on Michigan Ave. for over $200.00 a night & she said our room at the Tremont was larger. When we stepped outside the hotel & my grand-daughter said "where is the American Doll Place" - a woman passing by said it's right down there. The location is perfect for shopping & great restaurants. We had dinner at Mike Ditka's restaurant in the hotel & it was packed & food was wonderful. I will stay there when I return & recommended it to anyone I send to Chicago that wants a nice, safe hotel in a great location without spending lots of money. We bought some of those wonderful candles they had in the lobby. ( I am a Travel Agent)

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Ifly4freee
Reviews.Content: This place is a hole. What a nightmare. I would have had more fun lighting $95.00 on fire. No I didn't expect the Ritz. But I do expect a clean, quite, smell free, place to stay. The lobby is nice, however I should have known something was up when a musty smell hit me in the face as the door opened. The elevator is a death trap waiting to happen. Slow, old, rickety. The carpet in the elevator was dirty and coming away from the walls. Once in our room the musty smell hit us again. The furniture was beaten up, carpet was coming away from the walls, everything looked dirty. I didn't want my bare feet to touch the carpeting. We pulled back the shower curtain and mold was in the grout of the tiles throughout the whole shower. (see the pictures) We checked out immediately and found another hotel. For what we spent total after getting another room at another hotel, ($230) we could have skipped PL (who we love) and gotten a really nice room. Priceline should get rid of this hotel. Or for that matter any online agent should refuse to sell this hotel. This hotel is the true definition of dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nezret
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying at the Tremont after reading many of the reviews on this site. I booked the Tremont through Priceline for 5 nights at $75. per night. Priceline ranked this hotel as being 2 1/2 stars. Our stay was excellent. The hotel is old, but completely clean. Our room was very comfortable for two adults. The elevator was not slow as some people complained in their reviews. The location is unbeatable. 3 Blocks from the CTA red line and literally steps from Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile. Our room had a great view of the Hancock building. If you're looking for fluffy robes in your bathroom and 200 cable channels- go somewhere else. If you want a nice, clean hotel, with comfy beds, nice staff and fantastic location for a really good price- this is the place for you. I would definitly stay at the Tremont next time I go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us, depends what your wanting out of your hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jhaught
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on Hotwire, I was having a hard time finding a room anywere else under $150-200 a night, we got the Tremont for $92. The reviews on tripadvisor are very + and -. Here's our opinion of it. It has a great location right off of Michigan avenue and across the street from he Hancock Center. The hotel is old, the elevator is slow and the rooms are in definite need of repair, however the room was clean and safe and I knew when I booked it that I wasn't going to get the Four Seasons for $92 a night. I also didn't book a room on Michigan avenue to spend all my time there. When we go to Chicago we spend very little time in our room we sleep and change clothes that's about it. It definitely served its purpose for us. I do have to disagree with Hotwires rating of three stars it was more of a two star hotel. While I probably wouldn't actively seek this hotel out to reserve if I got it again on Hotwire I would stay. A few years ago we stayed at the Intercontinental and loved it, however it's prices have definitely gone up they were wanting $250 a night (we paid $65 last time) and we got the Tremont for $92, so the Tremont worked for our budget and served its purpose so if you get in on Hotwire or Priceline don't be to worried as long as you are prepared for it to be old don't plan on spending a lot of time here.

Reviews.Title: “A backpacker hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: $79 a night via Hotwire - they say its a 3 to 4 star hotel. Not quite sure who or how that rating came about. Location is EXCELLENT, no one could deny that at ALL. The place was built in 1929 ish and I dont think has had much work done to it since. There is one lift!!!! And it is SLOW !!! The rooms are old, tired and I mean TIRED. There are no twin rooms here either, everything is a Queen or King. I'm not thrilled about this place. The carpet in our room is dirty, the beds are kind of worn out, there is no duvet, noisy air con and the bathroom has crached bowls - really unhygenic! On the plus side..............ummmm, there doesn't seem to be one apart from the location. Knock it down and start again I say!

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain, and location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MauiKitty
Reviews.Content: I was leery about staying here after all the horrible reviews. OK, people, I got a rate of $110.00/night through Priceline. I was NOT expecting the Four Seasons. Arrived this past Friday (8/11) and were directed next door to the Tremont Suites. 4th floor suite with downstairs kitchen, restroom, living area with TV. Upstairs had a comfy Queen bed, many closets, TV and another full bathroom. Was there a view? No. Did I care? NO. I was less than a block from Michigan Avenue. I wasn't planning on hanging out in the room. It was clean, air conditioned and comfy. Were there signs of age? Yes. Was some plaster peeling? yes. Folks, this is an OLD hotel with a fantastic location. If I'd had to pay 300.00 + a night would I stay here again? I don't know. For $100.00 or so a night - ABSLOUTELY!

Reviews.Title: “Fitted Say What?”
Reviews.Author: HDogg
Reviews.Content: Room was okay, location was great, next to Coach Mike Ditka's restaurant. Only thing, no fitted sheets! Called front desk, they said they didn't supply them...

Reviews.Title: “Can't Complain for the Price”
Reviews.Author: attygirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Tremont I was informed the hotel was overbooked and I would need to spend the first night of my stay in Chicago at another hotel. At first I was upset (tired from travel and hungry), but the hotel refunded my first nights stay and then paid for me to stay at a $400/night hotel, The James. I was pleased with the Tremont staff for making an unpleasant experience pleasant. The James was out of this world, 42 inch plasma TV and trendy! Thanks Tremont! Now, on the second night in Chicago I had to check back into the Tremont. The Tremont is very old and yes, there are some less than desirable things going on (dirty looking ceiling? dirty windows). But the sheets were clean and the price($90/night in the summer) and the location (20 steps from Michigan Ave--Water Tower Place) you can't beat !!! If you are going to Chicago to shop and eat and hang out in town, this is a great hotel. If you are looking for a relaxing hotel and plan on spending a lot of time in your room, i suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: drmorf
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Tremont for five nights on Hotwire for $450 including fees and taxes. I was a little apprehensive after reading the reviews, but I wasn't disappointed with my stay at the hotel. The only negative thing I have to say was the $38 a night to park my rental car. Even with that charge it was still less than $130 a night. I stayed in the Tremont Suites which is next door to the hotel. It was basically a studio apartment complete with full-size refrigerator. I had brought my own ice chest because I thought I wasn't going to have a refrigerator, which one of the staff filled with ice while I checked in. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Yes, the elevator was slow, and the building was older, but the location was great! Two blocks from the Red Line, one block from Michigan Avenue, one block from Rush Street, a Starbucks across the street (Wi-Fi access $10 a day, which I could get a decent signal in my room), and plenty of shopping and restaurants wihin walking distance. If you are looking for decent accomodations in a great location then check this out. If you want a modern hotel in the same location, then you could pay $300+ a night a the Sofitel right up the street. The choice is yours.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: k&b7696
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights on our anniversary,we were given this hotel after picking it from Hotwires 3 star $89 rate grab bag. The location was great , the room was nothing to get excited about definately showing age, but we went to Chicago for Wicked, Second city comedy club, shops, and dining . We were not dissapointed with what we got for our money and the staff served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't go...old, diry and disgusting! Nothing like the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: KYTravellerPM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very old, which is not a problem - but the filth was! Upon entering my room, I found the rugs to be stained, the bedspread worn, stained and crusted up on the edges (there was a red stain in the center of the spread - which may have been food, but I was NOT going to get close enough to investigate). The bathroom was disgusting, cracked tiles and tub, bare spots where grout should have been, leaking faucet and zero water pressure and what may have been shampoo or something globbed up in the corners on the outside of the bathtub. The bathroom had a very musty-mildew-y smell. My wife had to wait thirty minutes after I had showered to take hers, as the drain to the tub was very slow draining. Someone had left a partially eaten gummy bear or some other type of chewy candy, as I was welcomed by a pile of ants when I tried to pull the curtains.
