I contacted the front desk in an attempt to be placed in another room, but was told due to the hotel being at near capacity, a switch was impossible. I'm surprised by how truly shabby this hotel was - believe the reviews and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: niki16
Reviews.Content: Room was VERY small. All of the furniture was covered in dust. Bathroom was dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Old, but clean and friendly staff, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also booked the the hotel via priceline bidding. After reading the last reviews, i was a concerned staying there. But after we arrived we were also accommodated in the Temont Suit next to the Hotel. We entered the room and were positively surprised. It is true the the hotel is old and would need an makeover (actually there are some construction works going on, but during the weekend we were not disturbed by any noise), but the room, bath and bed was clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. So if you are looking for a clean place to sleep, at a reasonalbe rate in a very good location (next block to Hanckock tower), we think the tremont is definetely the right place to look for. For the same purposed we'd go there again! Marcel

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: Dogfish60min
Reviews.Content: After being booked at this hotel through Priceline for a business trip in late May that coincided with an unusually expensive period of Chicago hotel rates, I was quite nervous that this would be a horrid experience, given many reviews. While this hotel is far from being luxury, I was pleasantly surprised to find it at least average. If you are looking for a 5-star hotel, this is not your place. However, if you are looking for a room that is reasonably clean and in a convenient location, this is not a bad option if you can get a competitive rate. I will not rush back to The Tremont, but I would stay there again if options were otherwise limited. The staff is reasonably friendly, and it is well-located for shopping/dining. Some of the most notable downsides to the stay were that there was only 1 elevator, the mattress was not overly comfortable, and the walls were rather thin between rooms. The hotel could certainly use a makeover, but the same is true for many older Chicago properties.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't care for the Tremont”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the staff was friendly and accommodating, the hotel is showing its age. The bathroom was clean, but deteriorating. You could see where the water was going behind the bathtub faucet and running behind the wall, so the trim was actually rotting and some of the tiles were lifting. The cabinets are painted wood, but the paint was peeling all over. The bed was comfortable and there was a decent TV. Sheets were a decent quality, although not exceptional. The morning trash trucks were just outside our window in the alley and were very loud at about 4:30 am. There is only one elevator in the hotel and it's very small - you can only fit about 6 people without luggage. One time the line was long so we took the stairs. We found that the kitchen at Mike Ditka's is on the second floor and the stairwell was really nasty - trash, grease, etc. On the positive side, the staff was wonderful. They were friendly and helpful when we needed a restaurant recommendation, taxi, newspaper, etc., however we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not anymore”
Reviews.Author: BiLiNuo
Reviews.Content: I also got stuck with this hotel using Priceline. This place is nowhere near the star ratings I've seen it at. The place was dingy, dirty. When we checked out, we heard someone telling that there were ants in its bedroom... I would never stay here again and would most certainly not recommend it to anyone else!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed with the customer service at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For such a high priced hotel their cancellation policy borders on combative. I suggest to find a more friendly and customer oriented hotel. When I plan to stay in Chicago again this hotel will get no consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got stuck with this hotel using Priceline. This place is nowhere near the star ratings I've seen it at. The place was dingy, dirty, and smelly. The bed was horribly uncomfortable, and the desk staff was rude and unpleasant. Their valet would park your car for you but you can save some $$ by parking it yourself a block or so north at the garage attached to the Four Seasons. I would never stay here again and would most certainly not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Sows ear sold as a silk purse.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel an average of 18 weeks out of the year - I know good hotels and bad hotels. When I arrived in room the floor had crumbs all over it from previous guest, the TV did not work, the dirty carpet smelled, and a turd from previous guest was floating in the toilet. This is not a hotel to which I can bring my wife. There is one (1) internet cable for ALL guests to use next to front desk - there is no other means of getting internet connection in the hotel. When I informed the Front desk that this was "ridiculous in this day-and-age" they said "fine - go across the street to starbucks if you want internet". As a business traveller, internet access is essential; I do a lot of work from Hotel rooms wherever I go- except this hotel. This hotel is not a place I can stay when on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My love and I stayed at the Tremont for three days during the week prior to New Years. We chose it because of the location and because we found an online special for $55/night. Even with the $40/day valet parking that made our total less than $100/night. It's an old hotel and it looks it in some places- it's certainly not 5 star, but it's not a total dump either. The inside staff was civil, but the valets were extremely courteous. Our room was pleasant enough, if a bit tiny- which was fine since we came to see Chicago, not stay in the room. The elevator is a bit slow and cozy- there was sometimes a line, but you can go through the door right next to it and use the freight elevator if in a hurry- although that lift did smell a bit. :) For the money, we were pleased with the Tremont, just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Very Saddening Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have seen better rooms that charge by the hour!! Worn out carpet, cracked walls and ceiling, no ice machine or concession machines available. Just about the worst experience I have ever had in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing about it”
Reviews.Author: SuzzyS
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better but everything else could be. It is very old and the rooms are very small - I can't remember in eons ever staying at a hotel where they didn't offer rooms with two double beds; I was with my son so we could only get two single beds. You have to go out to get food for all meals as the only restaurant is the attached and expensive Mike Ditka steak house. The staff at the desk was not helpful at all about places to eat in the area nor were they particularly pleasant. We didn't have to spend much time in the room so that helped. The price was right for us but then, I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “An Adventure!”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveler123
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here some years ago and found it "tired" but booked again at the last minute given the World Series was in town. The lobby and front desk reminded me of a down in the mouth European hotel. The main elevator was broken so we needed to take the service elevator. Unfortunately, it stopped one floor below our floor. Carrying our luggage, we had to walk up a dingy stairwell. When we reached our room, the door was open and tape was across the door with a sign that said wet paint. Not sure whether to laugh or leave, we took down the tape and entered the room. It was a large suite with 12 foor ceilings, huge windows with spectacular views, had a baby grand piano and a modern bathroom! Amazing! I'm sure we got lucky and would not bet that we could get the same room again. My suggestion is that the owners shut it down for a year, fix it up from top to bottom and then try again. It's in a great location and doesn't deserve to be what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Old & dirty”
Reviews.Author: cysnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of their "suites". Turned out to be an old run down apartment turned into a hotel room. The carpet and fixtures appeared to be as old as the building. The single carpeted elevator had doors that needed a nudge or two to close. Worst hotel I have stayed at in Chicago so far.

Reviews.Title: “OLD HOTEL & it's visible!!! Only 1 Elevator! But Nice Views!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel views are excellent and it's located right off the Mag Mile, but that's where the perks of this hotel end. The hotel is OLD!!! And has not been renovated ever??? The rooms are extremely small, the bathroom fixtures look to be the originals. The paint in the rooms look like they just keep coating one coat after another, and it's obvious! The rooms are all overly hot, and the thermostat in the room doesn't seem to help. The front desk said all the rooms were this way. We literally had to open the window, when it was 40 degrees outside. There is only one elevator for 16 floors! You have to wait forever to get on! I hate to think what happens when it's down. If you're visiting Chicago and only plan to crash in your room, then the hotel is okay. But if you're spending more then 5 minutes in your room, then look for somewhere else to stay!!!!! The hotel isn't old school, traditional charm...it's just plain old!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!!”
Reviews.Author: daniagirl
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tremont through Priceline and after reading reviews, we were very apprehensive!! We enjoyed our stay at the Tremont. The location is worth the price of the room - we were in walking distance of the magnificent mile and had a room with a view of the Hancock building in the next block. Yes, the hotel is old BUT still elegant. The room we had was well appointed with the usual TV, hair dryer,telephone, iron and ironing board. The towels were fluffy and clean; the bed was OK and the room and bathroom were clean. The staff were helpful and courteous, we had a great location at a great price and we'll go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, Excelent Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really don't get it with some peolple who write reviews, The Tremont is a very old building built in the 1920's in the heart of Downtown Chicago, everything, and I mean everything is just blocks away. The Facade, Lobby and reception areas are really nice. There are actually 2 elevators, not too big, but they're ok. My room ( I speak for room 1009 only !!) was a bit small, but I can see they are maing changes, the spreadsheets, shower curtains, drapery, some area carpets were brand new. The mattresses have seen better times before , but the lady in charge of housekeeping told me they were going to change them. Improvements are being made and it shows, honestly, it is a nice hotel to stay at, I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremont has a great location but is a tired hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pantone_Jeff
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night at the Tremont Hotel a mere block from Michigan Avenue in downtown Chicago. The hotel itself is a smallish hotel with decor that ranges from 10 years ago, and backward. The lobby area is cozy as others have said, yet there was no music playing or other diversions going on to hold your attention. The staff was nice yet distant, smiling when spoken to, or looked at, yet not eager to answer questions or offer help. We were told upon arrival that the hotel's main guest elevator was out of service, and would likely be working within an hour or so. As of a day later at check-out, it was still out of service. This didnt seem like a problem as we could use the service elevator, but the problem was the infinite wait as the old elevator lumbered up and down ferrying EVERYONE in the hotel. The location makes it a nice enough place to stay, but after staying at newer and more up to date hotels in the area, we wont be back. Book it if you have no other option but avoid it you can.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: larkoolaw
Reviews.Content: Great location for visitors. Lobby is cozy and old school. Elevator is tiny- scary and they only have one- so tack on 15 minutes extra to travel time. I was moved to a lower floor so I could take the stairs. It looks as if they let people hang out and smoke in the stairwells-cigarette butts everywhere. Rooms- nothing special- lots of wear and tear- my door barely opened without waking the whole floor. What is strange is that with some paint and other TLC they could spruce this place up without spending much. Views are nothing special but that is to be expected in a crowded city. Free gym was better than nothing but not much to chose from. Still most places now charge for use. Overall this is most certainly not a 4 star hotel-- and they should not advertise as such. Also, the photos on the website are much better than the rooms actually are. Overall, not horrible but they should try and fix the place up. I am not sure what the room cost are but I am sure they take advantage of thier location.

Reviews.Title: “not what it used to be?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Judging from the lobby, this hotel used to be quite a lovely place. No longer. Starting with the fact that it only has one small elevator for the general public, it was a great disappointment. The room was shabby--furniture battered, bedspreads stained, nothing too clean. The bathroom shower curtain had mold on the edges and there was mold on the ceiling over the tub. Also peeling wallpaper and tile. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Travelers Only!”
Reviews.Author: noplainjayne
Reviews.Content: This is a European style hotel (think small) in a superb location that is suitable only for a budget traveller. It's location near the Hancock building makes it an ideal location. But it is very shabby, and everything has a very worn appearance. If you want a great location, can get a bargain rate (we paid about half of what any other hotel in the area cost), and just need a place to sleep, this might be your place. If you want to impress someone with luxury, great service, and nice furnishings, or can't get a great rate, choose another location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I left the Tremont hotel angry. This was the worst hotel experience I've ever had in my life. First off, there is only one elevator for the whole hotel, and although it is not a big hotel, it definitely needs more than one. They allow you to take the freight elevator, but avoid it unless you like going in grimey, stinky, small spaces. We were told by the front desk that they can book an architectural river cruise tour and that we will get $10 off the regular price and that when we return, we will get the $10 back. This was a complete lie and management did NOTHING to resolve this issue. The worst about this hotel? The PAPER THIN WALLS. The first 2 nights we were there, we were woken up by the sounds of a woman in the next room making and receiving calls before 8AM. We could hear EVERY SINGLE WORD uttered. The third night was the best though. At 3AM, we were awoken by 2 drunken young girls swearing and laughing about their night out on the town. Of course the daily alarm clark that went off in the same room next to us at 9PM was wonderful too. The staff ignoring our request for them to turn the alarm clock off completely, and not just for that night was of course ignored.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay. I think some people want the Ritz but don't want to pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tremont. I did not have all of the "issues" that some other people are claiming. Sure it is an older hotel. The building itself is old. So you can imagine that they are limited on what you can do with space. I asked about the door man as I heard they don't open the door for you. They don't have one. It is the valet people out front (who are not actual employees of the hotel). They said they do have a bellman (who I had the wonderful pleasure of talking too!) but he is the only one. FOLKS THIS IS A LIMITED SERVICE HOTEL, you pay for what you get. When you book on many websites, the fee is NON_REFUNDABLE, so why should the hotel refund your money, when it was the other company who you paid ( I also learned this from reading the websites I was booking on). My room may have been worn, but it was clean, and the room attendant was very cheery. I travel a lot and from what I really have seen with my own eyes is that many people want everything for nothing. I have been staying at the Tremont for years and I have seen it go from it's hey day to it is "okay" now. Why do I still stay there? The location is wonderful and it is a good value for the price. You cannot stay anywhere else that has the cost and location. Like I said before, if you want to be pampered stay at the 5 Star hotel, but be prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “It's unanimous!”
Reviews.Author: jskar
Reviews.Content: It seems that whenever we book a room through a discounter, we get a small room, a dingy room, or a room in the worst location. Although reserving a room with a king bed three months in advance, they claim that they did not have one available. Both windows shades were ripped and broken. The furnishings were overly worn. The bathrooms were too small, too. Luckily, our air conditioner did work well. This hotel even charges $3 per bag if you check them in earlier than your check-in time. While a few dollars cheaper than other hotels, it really is not worth the savings. Stay elsewhere. (The Raphael is a very nice alterative.)

Reviews.Title: “No problems for us - are we all talking about the same hotel here?!”
Reviews.Author: AllyS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, as part of our three week tour of the states. Absolutely no problems - ok, so it's a bit 'shabby chic', but it's clean, the staff were friendly and professional and it's in a fab location, right next to the Hancock building. Would definately reccommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Barbie63
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire and I cringed whenever The Tremont was revealed to be our $90 per night room because I had read the terrible reviews on this site. Aside from the wonderful location, this hotel has little to offer. I called ahead and requested a room with a kitchenette. Gabriel recommended the Tremont Suites, located next door, also available for the $90 per night rate. First of all we were told that the bed would be a queen sized one. We always try to get a king-sized bed while traveling. Lo and behold we were given a full sized or double bed, pure torture for two full sized adults. The size of the room was quite small too. The bathroom was soo small that whenever you sat on the toilet your entire left side was jammed against the sink,very uncomfortable! The kitchette was rendered practically useless because of lack of utensils,plates,pans and other kitchenware. They did deliver a few items, 2 forks, 1 spoon, a cheap skillet and a few plates,but we had to purchase dish soap and a scouring pad. Also the refrigerator was not working for the first few days. They did replace it with one that seemed to work better. The air conditioning unit made a very loud noise. The elevator broke entirely on several occassions forcing us to walk up 4 floors. But the real treat of staying at The Tremont was being awoken each morning by the building literally shaking because they were demolishing the building next door! What an experience! Never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: allenak5
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel off hotwire, claiming to be 4 stars. RIGHT. It was dirty: peeling, stained carpet, a funky smell, burn marks on the wall...I could go on and on. The location, right across from Water Tower, was good but did not make up for the general nastiness of this joint. AVOID IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe All Of The Reviews: This Place is AWFUL and dirty”
Reviews.Author: travel79
Reviews.Content: The lobby and facade of this building is very deceptive, it looks quaint and charming, until you get to your room! We knew this hotel wasn't going to be luxurious, but what we experienced was ridiculous. We could have lived with the small rooms, the un-air conditioned elevator and poorly lit bathrooms but not with the following: 1) There was a large (foot long or so) crack in the wall with mold growing out of it, above the crack the ceiling was beginning to cave in too. 2) The bed was awful and very uncomfortable. The pillow had blood stains and there were black stains on the sheets. 3) The vent above the bathroom door looked like it had never been cleaned. It was black with black dust surrounding the entire large vent. 4) The carpet was just plain disgusting. 5) The mirrored closet door had 3 cracks in it and duct tape trying to hold it in to place. 6) There was another large vent on the bathroom ceiling that had a cover that was hanging down about 3 inches from the ceiling. This vent was just as dirty if not worse than the one in the bedroom. 7) The bathroom door handle was falling off. 8) There is no lighting by the shower, which is probably good since there is mold growing in the cracks of the tile. 9) The window looked like it had bever been cleaned. 10) There is no 24 room service or vending machines in this hotel. Which means if you want a soda or a bottle of water you need to trek to the Walgreens three blocks from the hotel. You couldn't look at any point of this room and not see filth or mold! We have no idea how this hotel was rated a 3 - 4 star on various sites. Spend another $20-$30 on your hotel and stay anywhere else! The one small saving grace is the location, the hotel is within walking distance of just about everything and right between Michigan Ave. and Rush. Street. Location is not everything though!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, old and small--Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for one night on the 4th floor. The carpet is very old and dirty. Wallpaper peeling off the wall in the room. There were ants in the bed sheets--thank god it wasn't bedbugs. Only vinyl miniblinds on the windows so forget about light blocking to sleep in. Air conditioner did not work very well. I have no problem with budget hotels and expected a small room and older furnishings. But I draw the line at filth and pests in the bed.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first got there, we couldn't get anyone to take our bags into the hotel.(The doorway was narrow, and the doormen wouldn't even hold the door open). They were standing around outside looking at each other like a bunch of buffoons. When we checked out a day early from this dreadful place, we called for someone to come and get our bags to take them down, and nobody ever showed up to get them. We had to take them down ourselves which wouldn't have been bad except that the elevator was so small you could hardly get the stupid baggage cart into it. Now for the room. It had to be the smallest room I have ever stayed in. Think walk in closet with a bathroom attached. The mini bar was leaking and the carpet was so dirty I wouldn't walk barefoot on it. The bottom of our socks were filthy. There was wallpaper peeling off the wall in the bathroom and it was dirty looking also. I wished that I had shower shoes. While we were there the elevator was stuck on the second floor for hours causing us to take the stairs which went by the kitchen causing them to be greasy and dangerous. Falling might have been the only way to get our money back for the night we didn't stay due to checking out early. They absolutely wouldn't refund us for the night we didn't stay. The staff at the desk were very rude! The parking garage is up a couple of blocks and around the corner and costs $24 a day. You better hope it isn't raining if you have to walk to it. Next time we would stay at the Sofitel which was near and looked to be a lot nicer! I don't know what the other reviewers were talking about when they said it was charming. Do yourself a favor and DON'T STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: MLawlor
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room on the 15th floor. Very good view, funky shaped room. The furnishings and carpet were shabby; much in need of upgrading. Air conditioning unit was noisy all the time. This is a no frills hotel with a decent location. Not terrible for the downtown price of $129 + tax.

Reviews.Title: “Better off at the Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An absolute rip off! Thought I was getting a deal close to Michigan avenue, and getting ready to move to the windy city, it was close to my interview. However, the problems just kept on coming. When I checked in (through hotels which locks you in by the way), not only did I reserve a king "deluxe" room which I guess I had assumed would include decent furniture and a clean carpet. It was not available and had been given to someone else since I had reserved "online". Which I didn't, I reserved by telephone with the hotels, who are now refunding part of my fees. Making me feel much better. After complaining about this they moved me into yet another dingy room with a larger bed. The next day, I was ironing my white shirt for my interview that had a nice covering of rust that came off onto my shirt that I was supposed to be wearing within an hour. I called and asked for a replacement iron, and complained. The replacement took longer than 20 minutes to get and then did not even work! And the ironing board was quite soiled. . .at that rate it just didn't seem to matter. I called hotels and they told me that I could move into another hotel by talking with the Tremont. I requested this, and of course the Tremont refused. The next day, I asked if there was internet, and there wasn't. Good thing I didn't bring the laptop, since I found out later that they charge you per minute. I asked to borrow a telephone book, and they didn't have one available. I called the front desk, and asked how much their long distance rates are, and they told me at&t rates. I said, oh, like 5-10 cents a minute? And front desk clerk said probably. The day I was leaving, after 4 nights, I awoke to find a $200 phone bill where I was getting billed at $1-$2 per minute! Where I could have just used my pre paid cell phone. I called the front desk, they put me on hold and never picked up again. So, I went downstairs. I told them that there was not any signage in the room about these fees and that the person I spoke to did not tell me it was this expensive. I told them I would not pay that bill, and finally expressed that I really try to maintain my anger as a trying Buddhist practicioner and this was really getting on my nerves. I was finally given some room to negotiate and ended up paying still a rip off sum of $50. I was also nicely informed that I should know that hotel telephone fees are expensive. And, by the way, the doorman does not always open the door for you. Not the most friendly atmosphere. All in all, it was absolutely horrible. I will never stay there again. Too bad I didn't take some photos

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it! MUCH better than other reviewers claim!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was dubious about staying at the Tremont based on so many reviewers slamming it here. What a pleasant surprise to find out that nearly all of the claims were gross exagerations. I've found this with a few other hotels that got less-than-stellar reviews on Trip Advisor--some people just love to whine and expect perfection and they seem to enjoy dramatizing things here. Sure, it's an older hotel, but it is absolutely charming and very romantic. The lobby has a quaint elegance, including comfortable leather couches and chairs and a piano. There was excellent free coffee served there each morning. The entrance to Ditka's restaurant is right off to the side of the entrance--I had the best burger of my life there. Our only check-in issue (if you can call it that) was that they seemed to have us booked for two hotel rooms instead of one--no problem! The pleasant and professional woman at check in just cancelled one room, checked us in for the other, and that was that. We stayed on the 12th floor, and despite there being only 1 elevator for the 16 floor hotel, we never had to wait long. The room was just fine and had a wonderful old world charm, complete with hanging prints and what looked like a fairly fresh coat of paint. There was NO peeling wallpaper in the room nor mold in the bathroom. The bedsheets were clean. I saw one tiny cigarette burn in the blanket on ONE day only, but big deal--you find that at many hotels. The A/C worked fantastically, the beds were extremely comfortable (I have a bad back and am picky about this) and the pillows were nice and fluffy. We had a gorgeous view of the city. The room did not smell at all--no mildew, nada. Maid service kept the room clean and neat. They were very prompt about cleaning the room as soon as we left for breakfast (and we got up later than most other guests every day.) Checkout was smooth and uneventful. The doorman was always ready and willing to call us a cab at a moment's notice. As for the lack of ice machine, all one had to do was go down to Ditka's restaurant (within the hotel) and ask for ice. They gave people paper buckets or cups of ice, depending on how much they needed--even after the restaurant was closed. Our only minor complaint was that we wished there had been more TV channels to choose from--not a big deal. The location is PRIME! You are right there in the middle of everything--across from Water Tower Place and walking distance to everything. Other than going to and from the airport, we only took a cab once the whole time. Walking and convenient subways took us everywhere. We will very likely go back to the Tremont--the price was right for that part of Chicago and location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Experience”
Reviews.Author: SNOWDROP252
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked here for five nights but moved out after three days! Let me explain! On arrival carried out an inspection of the room and checked the bedsheets. Although a previous reviewer had mentioned holes in the sheets, I was not prepared for what I found. Yes holes in the sheets, grubby carpet, damaged/stressed furniture and wallpaper peeling. The wall where the air conditioner was located was filthy. Checked the safe and noted that it was locked. I immediately went downstairs to complain and Gabriel the receptionist (initially a bit hesitant to give me his name when requested) was extremely helpful when I requested a change of sheets. On my return from dinner that evening the sheets had been changed so top marks for that. Safe was opened for me on the second day and to my surprise an expensive item of jewellry was found by me in the safe. I duly despatched this to the receptionist. I hoped that this would be returned to the loser, (obviously the previous occupant of the room). My requests for follow up (of the loser) over the next two days met with a less than satisfactory response. In fact the receptionist was unable to tell me the location of the local Police Dept. I met a cop downtown on the third day and passed my concerns on to him. Would I stay there again, most definitly NOT

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed on my second visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Tremont and I would have to agree with the reviews I have been reading. Another daughter and I stayed at the Tremont three years ago and I was very impressed at that time. It appears that the rooms have received little if any sprucing up since then. The location is very handy and it has the potential to be a wonderful "boutique" hotel but it will require some investment from the owners. Our wallpaper was peeling, the armoire that holds the television appeared as if it had substantial water damage, the carpeting had holes. And, our thermostat made a very loud vibrating noice that awakened us every few minutes all night long. I did not encounter these maintenance issues on my previous visit, and actually have recommended The Tremont to many friends since then. I made a mental note to follow up with them to find out if they were as disappointed as I was on my second visit. We checked into The Drake on our second night and had a wonderful experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Forewarned was forearmed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Hotwire for $101 per night and was pretty nervous upon finding all of these scary reviews, since I had already prepaid for my two nights there. I was visiting Chicago with my three year old son and we had a wonderful time overall. Having read about hairs on the bedding, I was prepared and not too freaked out to find a long hair on one of the pillows and several on the blanket. I also found wallpaper coming up at several places in my room/bathroom, although it wasn't hanging off of the walls, as I imagined. Yes, a bit of mildew in the bathtub corners and missing tiles along the bathroom floor. However, the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Upon checking the room, I found that one of the bedside lamps did not work and they brought a new one while we were at dinner. We had to leave our bags and were told, quite apologetically, that there was a $3 per bag charge. It's a shame, because you can tell that it was a very nice hotel at one time and with some sprucing up, could easily be once more. The location was unbeatable and we took advantage of the new free trolleys that take you virtually anywhere you would want to go.

Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is the worst value I have encountered in all my travels in the US. Dirty towels in the room, garbage left in the waste baskets, no in-room coffee maker, no bottled water, exaggerated claims about a "fitness facility", and it's in the dark ages with respect to internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: lissettd
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying at the Tremont after reading all the reviews, but it wasnâ€™t too bad. Yes, the hotel is old and dark and definitely not a 4-star hotel but the location is great and for the price we paid we couldnâ€™t complain. Our room was small but it was clean and the bathroom was renovated and very clean. If you are going to Chicago to enjoy the city, smart choice if you get a good deal, but if you plan to stay in your room while in Chicago then stay elsewhere. Oh, I did get charged $2 for making a 1-800 call.

Reviews.Title: “big mistake!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I have to say about the Tremont is: good location and Ditka's restaurant in the hotel was good. When we arrived we discovered you must pay $38.00 a day for valet parking or drag your luggage for two blocks. We arrived at 2:50 but were told check in was 3:00 and we would have to wait. The staff was VERY unfriendly and were almost rude. There is only one elevator for 16 floors so we always had a long wait. Our room was 80* but the ac wasn't turned on yet for the season so we opened the window and prayed a breeze would come in. There are no vending or ice machines and when we requested ice- they were sending it up and it never arrived. They do not have coffee makers in the room but there is a Starbucks right across the street.(wink wink) could there be a connection. The overall look of the hotel is dark,shabby, dirty, peeling wallpaper, the mirror in our room was broken and someone had duct taped all the cracks. My advice -GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Perfect Location & Nice People!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that I picked Tremont Hotel where my husband and I stayed for 4 days. Unlike other reviewers, we were very sartisfied with the hotel. Yes, hotel was not new, but they keep room and bathroom very clean every day. With perfect location, the price was really reasonable!! People at hotel were nice, especially a valet parking guy! Anyway, all things considered, I rate Tremont Hotel "Excellent"!

Reviews.Title: “great location freindly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location and i can not fail it in any way . the rooms are clean wall paper could do with bit off paint but we where never in hotel long enought to see what any off the below complaints are all about , the sports bar next day sold the best meals in chicago we found and everyone was so friendly Hightly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay Rack rate”
Reviews.Author: LB1488
Reviews.Content: Priceline put me here - at $85 for one night. Was terribly worried after reading these reviews. Don't worry - it's got its charms and isn't dirty. But don't pay a full rack rate either - or you're getting screwed! Pros: location. One block from Watertower, which is gold coast/mag mile perfect. Lovely lobby, nice staff, reasonably sized room, clean (and that I'm ridiculously picky about). Cons: upstairs is definitely in need of the renovation others talk about. Just looks shabby (peeling paint/paper, broken shades). And the rooms do have an odd smell (one night didn't bother me, but a week might) that I now need to purge from my clothes. Long story short: it's just old and in need of some TLC. It's not an amenities-plush new hotel. But it's clean and the real estate is what you're paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Really not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tremont the first weekend in Feb 2005 and I thought it was ok! It wasn't the best hotel I've ever stayed in but it was clean and the location just can't be beat!!!! Yea, the wallpaper was peeling but WHO CARES?? It's wallpaper. The shower/tub was clean...no mold. The water pressure was better than most! The floor did seem a little dirty. The carpet probably could stand to be replaced. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful!!! The room overall was ok and I do believe I would stay there again. I'm a woman who has a very clean and orderly house but I understand that that not all hotels are going to be just like home. Again, the location simply couldn't be any better. We were literally a half a block to the John Hancock building, which by the way has an awesome view from the top!!! Michigan Avenue was a half a block away and there was a Starbucks right across the street!!!! I also had no idea how close Rush street was. We were able to walk to all of the bars on Rush! It was great! Mike Ditka's is right next door to the hotel. You don't even have to leave the hotel to get to it. It's connected! We had lunch there and the place was packed and really good! If you are not high maintenace then I think this place will work for you!

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid $78 for a two bedroom suite one block from Michigan, and most times a room can be had for around $130. Yes it is old and the furniture worn but the room was clean and the baths newly remodeled. My suite also had a full kitchen. I don't go to Chicago to sit in my room and marvel at the ammenities. You need to pay at least $275 a night to get the kind of accomodations many other commenters seem to need. For a decent room in a great location this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: jpm
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible hotel--- when you first walk in it seems like it might be a nice boutique hotel, but when you look more closely, the furniture is all chipped or warping, the place is not very clean, and the staff at the front desk are not friendly or helpful. I booked this for my wife's birthday thinking it would be nice, given it's location (which is admittedly excellent). It was a very very big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tremont Hotel is just plain awful! The first room that I was given at the hotel smelled like a bar at closing time. Smoke generally doesn't bother me, but this room smelled like it needed to be aired out for a month. When I returned to the front desk to seek resolution of the problem, I was advised that it was a "non-smoking" room, so it could not possibly have the problem that I reported. Following reassignment to a "smoking room" (without a hint of smoke), I learned of various other problems at this hotel. The room had a broken mirror door on the closet. Rather than repair the large break or replace the door, the hotel had placed scotch tape over the jagged glass edge. The scotch tape clearly had been there for a while. The furniture pulls in the room had broken off (drawers and doors). Rather than repairing them, the pulls were simply placed inside the furniture, screws and all. Why someone didn't take the 5 minutes required to repair such a minor problem is a mystery to me. The filter placed across the vent in the bathroom was absolutely caked with dust, etc. Unfortunately, it was placed directly above the bathroom vanity, so there was no escaping the clumps of dust that occasionally dislodged from the old, overtaxed filter. No bottled water was provided in the room. I don't even think the hotel provided an ice bucket and I never found vending machines on my floor. The iron in my room was broken and the ironing board cover was heavily soiled. I requested replacement of both. Someone on housekeeping staff brought up an iron that was missing buttons and an ironing board with a cover that was somewhat less soiled. Yes, it's close to Michigan Avenue and that's great, because you'll often find yourself wanting to escape from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit dissappointed, overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my mother stayed at this hotel for a holiday trip to Chicago. I got a very reasonable rate from a internet hotel web site and for the price I paid, the hotel was ok. It is a older hotel, you can see the wear within the hotel and the rooms. Rooms had not been updated for a very long time. The bed I would have to say was the worst, I could feel the springs within the mattress. Although the bathroom was new and the room was overall very clean. The only problems were with the decor itself. Ex: Peeling wallpaper, cracked mirror and fixed with duct tape, very old carpet (I wore slippers the whole time). Amenties are very limitied. No in room coffee maker or mini bar. On a lighter note, the location is Fabulous. You are half a block walking distance from both Michigan (sits diagional from Water Tower Place) and from Rush Street. The hotel does have a very private, quaint atmosphere about it, I just wish the rooms were a little bit more updated. The Staff (both front desk and bellman) were VERY friendly and welcoming. Overall, we were happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Drake!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just Terrible! We paid $300 through Hotwire, which I now know is much too high. Our first room (which wasn't ready when we checked in at 3), was just awful. The mirror on the closet was broken, and fixed with a healthy dose of duct tape. There weren't enough towels or cups (only enough for one person), and the room itself was dirty- hair on the bed, and blood on the walls. The internet (at a whopping $20 an hour!!) was useless as the jack was out of the wall and on the floor. The curtains were dusty and there was dirt on the walls and ceiling. The staff was very nice about allowing us to change rooms. Our second room wasn't much better. Somewhat cleaner, but still shabby (peeling wallpaper, stained carpet). Our linens were a mess- cigarette burns on the comforter, and holes in the sheets (some large, some small- we could see the mattress through one of the holes in the sheets!) They claim to have mini bars, but they don't stock them. Instead, our mini-bar was defrosting all over our carpet. Also, the hotel has several flags hanging outside the building. They don't take the flags down at night (a protocol no-no), and if there is wind (likely in Chicago), the flag poles clang and rattle all night. Not very nice. On the plus side- the location is great. Chestnut street is fairly quiet for the area, and you can't beat the views of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would Look Else Where”
Reviews.Author: am37
Reviews.Content: Oh my God... We first booked w/ The Raphael Hotel, got there and they overbooked, so they moved us to their sister hotel, The Tremont, which i heard was a better hotel. So if this was better than the Raphael, then I'm thankful.. They put us in a tiny corner room, the size of my smaller bedroom in our apt, thats pretty small! The bathroom was the nicest place in there. Everything was extremely old, it all needed to be remodeled. For the price of $ 150.00 i wish i had looked around more, but now i now and will not go back

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for the weekend. I had read all the reviews the day before going and was simply terrified. I tried to brace my mother for the worst because I didn't know what to expect. When we arrived the lighting in the lobby was dark, but it was okay. Once we got checked in and went up to the room. The room was small but it was clean, the bedding didn't match. But with a can of Lysol to spray on the bedding, all was well. The best advise I can give is do not use valet, park on the next corner in the public ramp. You'll have to walk a block or two to the hotel but it's $23 a night versus $38 valet. Breakfast at the Temple Cafe on the corner was wonderful. Be prepared to wait!!! Oh, the free trolley will get you to Sears Tower the Museum Park etc. We weren't in the hotel much so it served it's purpose. The location is perfect..

Reviews.Title: “OK only if you get a low rate”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: The key here is the value you get for the rate you pay. If you get this hotel through Priceline or other internet service, you will probably be satisfied, because you are knowingly accepting a lower quality rating for a lower rate, in this particular location. If you pay published rates, then I can't imagine being happy with this hotel at all. There's just too many other choices out there. The Tremont is quiet, ideally located in the Rush St. neighborhood, quaint and charming. The rooms have a certain character, very appealing but the carpets are in dire need of cleaning or replacing. For this reason alone this hotel doesn't belong in a 3 star quality level - one expects 3 stars to be clean. The staff is very cordial and pleasant and will do their best to accommodate you, but let's face it, they don't have much to work with. I envision this hotel to be best suited to the more adventurous - young couples or college students, artistic types. or business travellers on a budget. Not a good choice for families.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: merrymerry
Reviews.Content: October 15th we spent the night at the Tremont in Chicago. Never again! Staff was nice enough, but the room was dirty and falling apart. Paint chipping, soiled chairs, mold in the shower, not enough towels, etc. Web site is very misleading, absolutely nothing like what you get. It shouldn't be rated as a 3 star, it barely makes it as a 1 star. Traveler be ware.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean and wonderfully located. It clearly hasn't been decorated in a few years but our room was certainly nowhere near as bad as indicated in other reviews. Would certainly go back, but if you're expecting 1000 sq ft rooms this isn't for you...

Reviews.Title: “Lakcing in every aspect - Dire Need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spend the night with my husband who was attending a trade show. In a word, AWEFUL. stains on the curtains, stains on bed spreads and stained and peeling wall paper. Drapes had ripe at the bottem hem and we were only given 1 bar of soap for both wash basin and shower area. Pretty shameful considering it was a $179 / nt room. I travel in my business quite alot in other parts of the country - never stayed in such a hotel in dire need of an overhaul. Quaint - sure if we only paid $80 - AWEFUL, yes, because we were charged so much during this busy month. Valet parking was a joke - waited 15 minutes for someone to give my keys to. No room service or restaurant for breakfast/lunch. Pathetic!

Reviews.Title: “Awaiting our next trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Tremont in April, we booked first then read the reviews, and we like others were a bit apprehensive before we travelled. We would not hesitate to go back here! The staff and location were great. The staff were very helpful, our room was clean and the bed was comfortable - what more could you want!!

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in much nicer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend of August 20 - 22 for the Chicago Air Show. We checked in on Friday morning and was advised that check in was not until 3:00 p.m.. I informed the desk that would be fine but I would leave my bags here. They have a sign that reads $3.00 charge per checked bags to be stored. NO OTHER hotel I have stayed in ever charged to hold my bags. I found this to be the worst practice I have ever seen. We were able to get our room right away. The room was small with a major crack in the ceiling with a piece of the ceiling hanging down over the doorway to the bathroom. The controls for the air were behind the cabinet with TV, if my husband and not been their I could not have moved the TV my self. The bathroom had wallpaper coming off and cracks and holes in the window in the shower area. The hotel is located in a perfect spot and with a little care it could be one of the best hotels. When we returned Friday afternoon to the hotel they had luggage lined up down the entry way to the elevator and into the lobby. (I hope this is not what they were charging the $3.00 per bag for because anybody could have taken any bag there. NO one was watching the bags or seeing who was coming and going.) Elevator did not work on Saturday morning and we were on the 9th floor. Another hotel guest told us the elevator was not working there was a sign down in the lobby after we waited about 10 minutes. We then took the Service elevator down.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: NDHawkFan
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a fine stay at the Tremont for two nights. I was a little nervous as others have been after reading the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. We parked in a parking garage on Delaware one block away to avoid the $40 valet charge. Still $25/day, but not bad. Check in was very pleasant. Had two rooms booked on hotwire. Be advised that the hotel pretty much has only single bed rooms only. We were given two rooms, one with a large king bed and one with a queen, both on the third floor so we could be on the same floor. There is only one elevator and it can be slow, but being on the third floor made for an easy trip on the stairs behind the lobby, if you don't mind seeing the kitchen on your way up. The rooms were well decorated I thought, and both had CD players as advertised. Views can vary, one room had a great view of Chestnut St and another the back of the place. Both rooms were very clean. Be advised, they are small though, but that's to be expected. There were some minor spots of peeling paint, but nothing major and nothing that looked unusual for an older hotel. The location can not be beat, we had a close walk to the El, Rush/Division restaurants nightlife. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, especially at hotwire prices.

Reviews.Title: “The Tremont Hotel is quaint and cozy. Our stay there was very pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the 4th through the 9th of July 2004 there and throughly enjoyed our accomodations, especially after reading several reviews that slammed the hotel. It was built in 1929 and reflects that period, as one should expect, but that does not mean it is a dump. The staff was polite and helpful. We shared a comfortable queen size bed and had a view of the John Hancock Center from our window. The water in the shower was hot and plentiful. The television screen was large and offered cable and pay-for-view. The room was clean and cozy. We were half a block away from Water Tower Place on Michigan Avenue. Our room was on the fourth floor and it was so quiet, I often wondered if the other rooms had occupants. In regards to the changing of linen so many have mentioned in their reviews, the rooms on our floor were cleaned daily and the bedding was changed. I do not change my bedding on a nightly basis at home. Therefore, I do not expect the hotel staff to do so. I requested housekeeping refrain from changing our bedding daily, or they would have. This practice wastes water and is unnecessary, unless one has had an accident in the bed. There are no accessible ice machines, but one may ask Room Service to bring some, or make a quick trip to the front desk and ask for it. In conclusion, I found a great price on the internet and considering the inflated prices of the neighboring hotels, it was a bargain. I received a good value for my money. I would definitely stay there again and will always remember our stay with fondness.

Reviews.Title: “Wannabe Rock Stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Tremont is in a great location - our room had a fabulous view of the Hancock Building, and I know that as with all real estate, desireability is based upon Location, location, location. That, however, does not make up for water coming from nowhere on the bathroom floor and the wannabe rock stars screaming in the hallway at 4am. Low prices in this locations seem to bring in rather seedy individuals who do not know how to conduct themselves. We'll be going elsewhere on our next visit to the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very nervous about this hotel after reading reviews on this and other various websites. However, we were very pleased with the hotel. It was an excellent deal and had excellent service. The room was clean and the hotel staff was very nice. Those that are complaining must have paid full price ($200) for the rooms. At a discount rate, you can't beat this hotel. The rooms are not enormous if you have a large room. The hotel shows wear, but was still in good condition. It is only one block off the Magnificent Mile. It was very quiet and convenient to many attractions of the city. We have stayed in many hotels from inexpensive to very expensive and this is definitely above average. We would be glad to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the naysayers - it's grand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire, and when the hotel name was revealed, I read reviews on Tripadvisor and got scared! Unnecessarily so. I travel a lot, and this hotel was nicer and cleaner than many chain hotels I've been in in the US. Tiny bit of paint peeling in the bathroom, but a great shower, great maid service, friendly staff. The only people who might not like the Tremont are those who only ever stay in Hyatts, and have never traveled much. Room was ample size, next to elevator which was quiet, with a lovely view of the Hancock Tower and the Lake. 1/2 block from Rush Street and from the Hancock Tower, 1 1/2 blocks from the free trolley at Water Tower Place. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value given the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times over the last 3 years and it has been fine for the price. If you're looking for a luxury boutique hotel this isn't it. If you don't mind an older property that got it's last extensive renovation about 20 years ago--and you're looking for a great value for the location then you've found the right place. I've gotten rates on-line as low as $60 per night--a cheap motel in the suburbs is almost that much. The rooms I've stayed in have been adequate: the furniture a bit worn and some cracked plaster here and there--but certainly not a dump and much better than a budget motel elsewhere in town. The staff has been helpful and polite. Complimentary pastries and coffee are offered in the lovely old lobby in the morning. Some friends of mine from California stayed here last year and they thought it was fine too. And you're half a block from frou-frou Michigan Avenue where some of the hotel rooms are three or four (or more) times the price! The money I save goes towards fine dining or shopping at Marshall Field's.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Shame on Travelocity for allowing this hotel as a last minute deal.....hotel website and descriptions are absolute lies. The room was filthy, old, and depressing....no air circulation, kept the window open the entire time just to breathe, and stayed out of the room as long as possible. Big wad of GUM stuck to a pillow sham....the entire experience was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't”
Reviews.Author: keithb789
Reviews.Content: Ooh, don't stay here. A client of ours from California had me book him a hotel in Chicago, and I thought I was getting a good rate on a botique hotel here in town. Wrong! According to our client, the place is a dump. He said he could tell as soon as he saw the lobby. I was so embarrassed. He hasn't had me book a hotel since.

Reviews.Title: “You won't get what you are promised.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with 2 double beds for a girls weekend and ended up getting 2 single beds, with no price exception or anything. The air vents were filthy which made me feel like I was probably breathing in soot. No CD player or Coffe Maker as prmised in the room. Not to mention that there are no ice dispensers on the floor so you have to request room service and they take FOREVER! GOod location and price, but jeez, don't lie to me about what I am getting! I will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, But In Bad Shape”
Reviews.Author: kaybsix
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in Feb.'03 and found it to be in bas repair. We moved once due the room being dirty and in speaking with others in the elevator, we found some people had to move 3 times to get a room that had heat and was remotely clean. Cleaning is a big problem, I can stand out of date features if the place is clean. But this is a problem at this hotel. It is a great location being one block from Michigan Ave. But I would not recommend it and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremont great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at Tremont. Used hotwire for great deal. Was scared by - reviews on this site. They were wrong, Tremont is nice hotel. Stereo with remote in room (Sony). Great bathroom with thermostat on shower! Even if it was a dump it is hard to beat location 1/2block from Water tower. Never waited for elevator more than a minute. Once while waiting was taken by staffer up service elevator so as not to wait. Ice thing no brainer. Who wouldn't rather have ice delivered than getting out and getting it ones self. Nothing did not work in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Yipes....what misleading ads!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in Chicago and five days at the Tremont.....NEVER AGAIN. We are both middle aged and have actually lived in Chicago, so we were familiar with the area. We wanted to stay near the Magnificant Mile and the ads for the Tremont sounded lovely.....WRONG The ads online are not true. No coffee makers in the rooms, paint and wall paper peeling, heat doesn't work (frost on our windows so thick we needed an ice scraper), someone attempting to enter our room at night (very scary), keys kept getting deactivated (staff made that our fault) terrible lighting, phone message system doesn't work correctly....and I could go on and on. Really a dreadful place.....AVOID IT.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised considering the location. I understand the small rooms in an older hotel but I was shocked by the condition of the room. Peeling wall paper, a torn bedspread, marks on the walls, badly stained carpet and chairs. One window covering did not work. No room service. If we were planning to stay more than one night I would have left. The only nice thing I can say is the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel near North Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: AHS-Moline
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. That is the only thing going for it. This hotel is part of the Starwood chain. They refuse to brand it as such due to the poor condition it is in. The website pictures of this hotel have to be several years old. Checked in, went to room, it was filty. From the water stains, to the oily, matted carpet to the dead bugs in the curtains. Asked to move to another room. It had leaked water from a drain, floor was moldy, wall A/C vents were black with several months of dirt. Windows had gresay head marks. Sheets and one bath towel had holes in them. Noise is a huge issue, when standing in the room, you can hear guests shoes shuffling on the floor as they walk down the hall. The doors rattle in their frames from the vibration of someone walking by. After two rooms in similiar disrepair, I asked for my money back, gathered my bags and moved to another hotel. One positive note, staff was very understanding of how I felt, apologized and politely refunded by money. They, off the record, acknowledged the poor condition and noted that the hotel owners felt that the hotel location would draw guests despite condition. Not this guest!

HotelInfo.Name: The Tremont Chicago Hotel at Magnificent Mile
HotelInfo.Address: 100 E Chestnut Street, Chicago, IL 60611
